event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_GENERIC_2
event.text: "Ah, hello Shellskenbry! Wonderful day we're having!" Anurak salutes to you.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_GENERIC_3
event.text: "I miss my caravan! Oh if only I could go back to my old life! Not the Duskbringer part, that's not what I meant by my old life! Don't think I want to be a Duskbringer again, because I don't! I want to go back to the caravan, and continue living as a nice, friendly, cowardly monk. It was a lot safer and a lot nicer. It was a little refuge for anyone who needed it. It didn't matter who you were or what you had done. As someone who's made a lot of mistakes in their past, I'm in no place to judge anyone looking for repentance. My secret? I just don't ask. I can only hope that if I forgive everyone, eventually they will come to forgive me."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_GENERIC_4
event.text: Anurak comes running out of the kitchem carrying a bowl of soup. He forces it into your hands, demanding that you taste it. He's in such a panic he won't even tell you why.

By the time you've barely even gotten the surprisingly tasty liquid down your gullet, Anurak is already prodding you. "Is it good? Oh by the Eye I think I used too much salt! It's ruined! I'm sure it's ruined, I've ruined the damn soup! I'm a terrible chef, and I can't even make soup with the right amount of salt! Oh woe is me!"
"Does it? Really? Crap, I don't remember how much extra salt I added now! Now I'll never be able to replicate this recipe ever again! I'm such a fool, I never pay attention to anything!"

choice.text: It's fine, though it is a bit too salty.

event.text: "I knew it! IT'S RUINED!" Anurak falls to the ground, sobbing. "I've ruined the soup, ohhhh it's awful! What do I do?! I can't remove salt! I have to start all over!" Suddenly, the Zoltan hops back to his feet. "Yes, I'll start over! And this time, I'll make the best damn soup you've ever had!"

choice.text: It's terrible. I regret drinking it.

event.text: "I knew it! Oh damn it! I'm never making soup again! No no that's a lie... I will definitely make soup again. And then I'll cry about ruining it again! Oh why am I like this? Why can't I just be normal?!"
Anurak continues to look at you expectantly, but when you finally make it clear you aren't trying the mystery liquid, he runs off to find some other crew to taste it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_DEVORAK_1
event.text:
Anurak, carrying a large pot of soup, manages to grunt out a question to Devorak, asking if he'd like any soup. Devorak turns to him, stares him dead in the eyes, and says, "I don't want your damn soup!"
Anurak drops the pot, and his arms go slack by his sides. "Oh... oh. I... I..." Tears begin to form in his eyes, when Devorak starts maniacally laughing. "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH! I'm only joking friend! Of course I'd love your soup!" Devorak nudges Anurak and winks, and the two begin to laugh together. After witnessing all of this, you're starting to think being in the Duskbringers has had some very adverse effects on both of their mental health.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_DEVORAK_2
event.text: You find Anurak and Devorak sitting at a table, playing some board game. As you walk past, Anurak shouts for you. "Oh Shellskenbry! Would you like to play?" Devorak nods. "Yes, we are playing the classic game of Jakeir. An exciting strategy game, I think you would enjoy!"

You take a seat at the table, and Anurak starts to explain it before Devorak cuts him off. "No, no need old friend. The captain can figure it out as we play, yes? Let us not waste time with instructions."
Anurak seems fairly annoyed. "But what if the captain doesn't figure it out? How will they enjoy the game then? It would be tragic, a calamity! Oh god this game will be ruined if th-" Devorak shushes Anurak. "Calm down, you worry too much. You musn't panic about everything, you will kill yourself with such worrying."
Anurak's panic only furthers. "No, don't you understand?! You don't worry enough, you just rush headfirst into everything! Why can't you be more of a coward like me! There is safety in caution, and you are nothing but a steadfast fool! GAH!" Anurak flips the table over, spilling the game pieces everywhere. You both look at him while he takes a few heavy breaths. "I know... I know you're not a Duskbringer anymore, Devorak. But you still act like one! You rush into everything and never think anything through!" Anurak storms off, and Devorak turns to you. "I just wanted to play a game. What was that?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_NOTHING
event.text: Devorak is meditating in his quarters. As you watch him from the door way, he pokes a look at you and closes his eyes again, signalling that you better find someone else to make conversation with.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_GENERIC_1
event.text: "They say a warrior is only as good as their weapon. I say a weapon is only as good as the warrior that carries it." Devorak bows, confident you grasp the wealth of depth in this wisdom.

choice.text: Isn't that basically the same thing?

event.text: "No. It is the same thing but reversed. The transitive property does not apply." Devorak bows again.

"No. Do not agree. You can understand, but you cannot agree until you have learned this lesson for yourself. It cannot be taught, only experienced. This too, must be experienced, not taught. And so, you will learn, that everything I could ever tell you is pointless and can be learned elsewhere. This is my greatest advice." Devorak bows again.
Devorak scowls. "There is no need for insults. I'm trying to give wise advice. Whether you want to accept it is not my problem, but rude words is how you make enemies."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_GENERIC_2
event.text: "It was a catastrophe, what happened back there in the city. I did not expect such brazen behavior from the Duskbringers. I... I guess I was deluded into thinking Zoltan supremacists would not be so hypocritical as to attack fellow Zoltan civilians? But of course, it was my greatest mistake to expect anything resembling reason from a fascist. To them, those people were 'necessary sacrifices'. I am disgusted by the justifications used by the people I once so proudly called myself a member of."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_GENERIC_3
event.text: "I AM THE INCARNATION OF DEATH! I HAVE SEEN DARKNESS AND TASTED THE BITTERSWEETNESS OF THE END! AND YET I AM WITHOUT DEATH! I AM THE DEATHLESS ONE, HE WHO IS IMMORTAL, WHO IS FREE OF THE BINDS OF LIFE! HAHAHAHAH! BASK IN MY PRESENCE AND WITNESS WHAT LIFE CAN BE WHEN IT HAS NO MORTAL LIMITS! HAHAHAH!"

Devorak clears his throat. "Uhm, yes. Sorry about that, just had to get it out of my system. Have I uh... mentioned that I think the Clone Bay has some... adverse effects on the Zoltan chassis? I think my neural framework may have decayed just a little while I was a Duskbringer. So, I apologize ahead of time for any chaotic outbursts."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_GENERIC_4
event.text:
"It's curious to me the suicide bombing is the tactic that everyone focuses on with the Duskbringers. I suppose it's just the taboo and the extremity of it that draws people's attention. But the Duskbringers employ a lot more than just bombing, it's more about warfare at any cost. Once, my team was racing against a Kleptocracy aquatic unit to capture an Aether supply line from the Dynasty. Being trained in such field, we were sure the day was lost. But then, one of my compatriots fell into a pool with the Slugs in it. They all died of electricution. The Zoltan died too, but of course we had a Clone Bay nearby."
Devorak ponders this story for a few moments. "Actually, I guess that would be a form of suicide bombing, technically. But that was just a bad example, okay?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DEVORAK_GENERIC_5
event.text:
"I am willing to sacrifice myself for the greater good of whatever noble cause requires it." Devorak bows, although it seems he isn't done.
"That said... I would generally prefer a Clone Bay be available nearby. Just because I'm willing to become a martyr doesn't mean I'm stupid about it. I'd rather live if I had the choice."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_NOTHING
event.text: "Apologies captain, I'm just giving the hat the old spit-shine! Well, trying to. My mucus has appeared to have stained the fabric and I'm having issues removing it. I'll be busy for a while, maybe you should check on the others!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_1
event.text:
You hear a knock on your cabin door and open it to find Freddy standing there. "Captain, I wish to share with you some gifts from my people! I've received a shipment of some various items from my old clan, gifts of sorts, that they wish to share with you! I'll just leave these here for you."
Freddy places down a large box full of crayon drawings, a several hundred page long fanfiction titled "How I married the Renegade captain and how we defeated the entire Rebellion and Ministry together part 1", and some unwarranted and explicit photography. You put the box in a safe spot and make a mental note to be more grateful Freddy doesn't act this way.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_2
event.text: You find Freddy scribbling away in a small notebook of his. You ask him about it, to which he responds, "It's a journal, where I practice the different galactic dialects I've been learning. Could you help me, actually, captain? I've been trying to master the Human language of Pan, but I've been struggled with some strange exceptions. Do you speak Pan well by chance?"

You help explain some of the strange intricacies of Pan to Freddy, and he scribbles away dilligently in his journal. "So, the rule is 'i before e except after c'? Yet there are dozens of contradictions. I'm terribly confused. I think I am beginning to understand though. Oh, if the Hive had only known how much the Fed-Mantis War would set us back, would we ever have made such a mistake? Oh why even ask. Of course we would have. It's simply in our nature..."
"Damn! Okay, I'll continue chiselling away at it myself. No worries."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_3
event.text:
In a rare display of egotism, you find Freddy bragging to the rest of the crew about his prized decorated shield. A hush overtakes the room as Freddy spins a tale of his encounter with the dreaded Bishop Kyiiiapitet, the leader of the 3rd Royal Brigade during the Fed-Mantis War.
"Kyiiiapitet made it his quest to eradicate the Free Mantis by his very own two claws, and the time soon came when my clan was next on his list. Already he had taken the lives of more than half of my former companions from the war, and I wasn't going to be the next! And I wasn't!"
Freddy thumps the ground with his shield, a prideful look in his eye. "That day was the same day the Free Mantis abroad revered me as their leader. It was also the day the Hive forbade the import of tea from the Union. Spiteful bastards."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_4
event.text: Out of curiosity, you inquire what Freddy's original Mantis name was. "What? Why would you need to know that? My name is Freddy, plain and simple. It has been so long since I last spoke native Yetiiik I can barely even remember how to pronounce it. 'Tiifleeiiik', I think. Eugh."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_5
event.text: You ask Freddy why he acts so different from the other Free Mantis, and if there are more like him. "What, more that do not poison our brains with brain rot? Of course, there are thousands of us! It's just that... well, we're the 'smart ones'. I mean no ill will to my less situationally aware brethren, but they are perhaps not the best representation of our culture. The original Free Mantis were engineers, scientists, architects, the thinkers who knew the sins of the war and fled from the Hive. When the Federation did not accept us, we organized into nomadic clans and founded the Free Mantis. The educated among us remain aboard more organized colony ships and rarely get involved in intergalactic affairs, or work for the Union or the Federation. I hope that is a sufficient answer."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_6
event.text: You spot some of the crew struggling to fix some minor damage in one of the subsystems with a welding torch, but before you can assist, Freddy enters and offers to help. With great proficiency he wields the torch and seals the hole quickly and efficienctly. When he spots you watching him, he merely explains: "While my dream of having opposable thumbs may never come true, I see no need to remain unskilled in that of handy work. It is not our biology that holds us back so much as it is our lack of a proper educational system."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_GENERIC_HAT
event.text: Freddy approaches, lugging behind him a wagon full of hats. You aren't sure where he got them from, but before you can inquire, he ask, "Captain! I was looking for a bit of fashion advice and was wondering what you thought about me changing my hat." Freddy gestures towards the pile.
"An excellent choice! I will try it on immediately!" Freddy tosses off his hat and places the Fedora on his head. "Thank you Captain! Now I'm looking stylish!"
"An excellent choice! I will try it on immediately!" Freddy tosses off his hat and places the Jester Hat on his head. "Thank you Captain! Now I'm looking stylish!"
"An excellent choice! I will try it on immediately!" Freddy tosses off his hat and places the Sombrero on his head. "Thank you Captain! Now I'm looking stylish!"
"An excellent choice! I will try it on immediately!" Freddy grabs a second tophat and places it on his head. "Thank you Captain! Now I'm looking stylish!"
"Alright, fair enough then Captain! I'll trust your word for it. I am quite fond of this hat... it's so dapper! Dapper is a word, right?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_KAZ_1
event.text:
While idly browsing the recreational room, Kaz bumps into Freddy, and the two glance at each other for an odd moment. Kaz bows and apologizes. Freddy accepts his apology but raises another question. "Might I ask, oh dreaded thief of legends, why it is you are always looking at me so strangely? You seem like a good fellow and I doubt you mean for me to take offense, but it is quite odd."
Kaz blinks, taken off-guard. "Oh, err. Well it's just that, well, thinking that Free Mantis are supposed to all be stupid, no? Drugs rotting braincells and all that. You not seeming stupid like rest though. You are not taking pheremones then, I assume?"
"Oh, uh. No, I don't. I played a pretty crucial role in the development of the synthetic pheromones concoction used by Suzerains and Bishops during the war, and I was able to recreate a more... 'experimental' recipe that the Free Mantis use. I never intended for it to be used in such masses, but that damage cannot be undone. Alas. But please, try not to call my people stupid. They're doing their best."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_FREDDY_KAZ_2
event.text:
You notice Freddy approaching Kaz on one of the cameras and tune into the audio feed out of curiosity. "Good morning, Mr. Plethkilik. I was wondering, if you don't mind me asking, why it is your translation files are still so broken? I've seen you speak beautiful Yetiiik and from what I understand you received a very comprehensive underground education."
Kaz shrugs. "Kaz is Mantis, pure and true. I may not always be greatest servant to Hive, but I cannot shaking inner nature as warrior. Because of this, other races fearing me. I get little practice speaking other language. Kaz also learning speak beautiful words from writing many love letter to beautiful Mantis woman. Kaz not finding much attraction to non-Mantis woman, so he not writing many love letter in other language either."
Freddy nods, although it's not the answer he expected. "Uhuh... alright. Well, if you ever bear the interest, I may be able to share with you some things I've learned. Mantis women, and warrior blood or not, I think you should find great benefit in communicating more fluently with other races." Kaz agrees, and the two shake claws and part ways.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_NOTHING
event.text: "Kazaaakplethkilik does not wish to speak right now. He is busy concentrating! Yes, concentrating very hard. On what, you might ask? Concentrating. Kazaaakplethkilik must learn the art of concentrating! So stop bothering me. You are breaking my concentration!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_1
event.text: With Kaz busy eating in the cafeteria, you take a quick look around his room, wondering if there may be anything of concern he's smuggled onboard. In a small box in the corner of the room you find some... compromising pictures of the Mantis queen. You jump when you hear the door open and Kaz enter the room. "You looking at Kaz things? Oh, heheh. There are more of those if you are wanting look at them, captain."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_2
event.text: "Kaz sometimes gets flirtations from women outside of Mantis species. Now I not wanting to sound old here, but I am not quite understanding allure of interspecies relationships. Perhaps it is cultural thing? In Mantis life, love and need to reproduce are pretty much same thing. Kaz has burning passion for attractive woman, but Kaz cares more about making many Kaz junior in galaxy. What great honor it is, being child of LEGENDARY THIEF!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_3
event.text: Feeling there's no better person to ask, you inquire with Kaz whether the rumors are true Mantis women will attempt to behead their mates. "What? Where are you hearing such silly nonsense. Kaz never sleeps with crazies, no no, but even when he makes bad judgement it is never HEAD they try to cut off! Some try to take limbs as trophies as proof of having sleep with Kaz, but never head. You should stop reading whatever source it is you are getting such weird ideas from. I am not thinking it is good source."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_4
event.text: While patrolling the ship you notice a red streak across the floor. Alarmed, you follow the trail into the kitchen, where you see Kaz busy sawing off the arm of some unidentified corpse on the counter. You're about to react, after a moment of temporary shock, when he reacts with glee to see you. "Captain, you are just in time! Kaz is preparing most wonderful dish for you and crew! Arm stew! Delicious, nutritious, everything growing boy or girl needing to be big and strong! Come, come, there is great feast on horizon!" Kaz digs into the corpse's skull and yanks out an eyeball and hands it to you.

choice.text: Accept the gift and join the feast.

event.text: Reluctantly, you gulp down the eyeball, shivering as you feel it rupture in your mouth. Kaz doesn't seem to understand your disgust but is delighted you've accepted his offering.

choice.text: Refuse the eye but allow the rest of the crew to decide if they'll join the feast.

event.text: You shake your head and give the eyeball back to Kaz, who frowns but shrugs. "Well, delicious eating is not for everything then. Kaz will still serve rest of crew if they are wanting! Waste not want not, that is what they are saying."

choice.text: Tell Kaz he cannot serve a corpse to the crew.

event.text: Kaz drops his posture for a moment and looks dumbfounded. "Oh... I was... I was just trying to make special meal for you and crew. I was not meaning to offend. Arm stew is such sought after treat in Hive. My apologies, captain..." Kaz saunters away, drawing his corpse with him.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_5
event.text: "Great Kazaaakplethkilik is needing new laugh! Very unsatisfied with current one. Is sounding more like Kikikik, when thinking it should be sounding like Kakakak! So if you are hearing sounds of deranged man trying to losing kidney stone, it is just me practicing."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_6
event.text: "Perhaps this is worrying of thing to say, but Kaz is empathizing with the Admiral Wentworth for loss of babymaking organ. If Kaz was losing it, he maybe becoming genocidal maniac too! Er... that does not sounding as flattering as I first thought. Maybe not then. There are other ways to make Mantis woman happy in bed, I think. Maybe Wentworth is needing taught such skills."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_GENERIC_7
event.text: Kaz approaches you meekly, one of the few times you've seen him not boasting his overconfidence. "Captain, I am wondering if you are able to answer one of Kazaaakplethkilik's many questions. His experience with Renegades are small, and it is vast culture he is wishing to learn more of. How might you defining the Renegade spirit?"

choice.text: We're guns for hire with no permanent allegiance.

event.text: "Ah, well there is something of nobleness in such a role, Kaz is thinking. A force of nature then, perhaps you are considering yourself? Or is Kaz too much stretching? Eh. Either way, Kaz can getting behind it."

choice.text: We're a force for good that makes money for our troubles.

event.text: "Force for good until you are being hired by bad guys? Or are you implying you have never taken contract from well paying client with bad intent? What if you are not knowing intent? So many implications I am thinking you are overlooking, but Kaz admires your resolve for good deeds."

choice.text: We're murderous, dangerous. I kill babies.

event.text: "Ah. Oh... First part, Kaz is thinking not too dissimilar from himself. Second part... I am recommending maybe you should not being so forthcoming with sharing. Just some legal advice, but I am not lawyer."

choice.text: I have dementia. What's a Renegade?

event.text: Kaz laughs, and keeps laughing, but slowly comes to a stop when you continue to stare blankly at him. "Errr... You are very... funny Captain. Heheh... uhm... I am hoping you are at least."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_KAZ_CLONEBAY_1
event.text: While idly checking on the crew you notice Kaz has dropped off of the crew manifest. Panicked, you check the cameras but fortunately he seems to already have cloned. You rush to the Clone Bay to ask him what happened but he's already gone. You follow him until you find him dragging a Mantis corpse back to his quarters.

choice.text: Did that Mantis board our ship?

event.text: Kaz pauses but shakes his head. "No no, this is corpse of me, captain! Kaz wanting cadaver so he can find which parts of him are squishiest and most cuttable. Must remake armor to account for all weak-points so that Kaz may becoming invincible!" You caution Kaz against abusing the Clone Bay like that but he doesn't seem fazed. "It is most okay captain, Kaz is not minding the pain or dark abyss. My solution to dreadful existiancial dillema is that Kaz is simply not care. Ship of Theseus can eating my feces."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_NOTHING
event.text: Tuco appears to have passed out on his bed, half covered by his sheets and snoring so loud from across the hallway you thought you were under attack. You try to get him to wake up but it's clear he's deep into a beer-coma. Seems you'll have to find someone else to talk to.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_1
event.text: You notice an assortment of musical instruments strewn around Tuco's room, various oddities he's brought along. You ask Tuco if he knows how to play all of them and he nods. "Most, at least. There's a couple I'm learning. Music is a big part of the culture of us Outcasts, along with storytelling. It's something the Theocracy has tried to oppress. Church music is an affront to music, let me tell you. I'd rather listen to a Hektar jingle on loop for the rest of my life than endure another second of a Chrysolic hymn."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_2
event.text: While in the middle of a game of 'Boarden', Tuco laments to you about the Theocracy's ban on gambling. "The Elders tired of people 'wasting' their money in casino districts instead of using it as donations to the Church." Tuco slams his fist down angrily on the breakroom table, sloshing some of his beer onto his playing cards. "I'll be damned if I give one bloody cent to those robed, preachy megalomaniacs. Say what you want about a gambling hobby, but at least it's a good time."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_3
event.text: For as long as Tuco's been on your ship you haven't been able to ignore a large belt he wears across his plated shoulder. A series of teeth or other sorts of similar organs from all sorts of species, primarily Rockmen, are stitched into the belt's fabric. Eventually, you work up the courage to ask Tuco about it. "Oh, this? This is my friendship belt! In it I have stitched a piece of memorabilia of all the friends I have met in my travels. Look, this one here is from Admiral Ariadne!" Tuco points excitedly at various teeth and lists off an impressive list of names. "Would you like to contribute to it, Captain?"

choice.text: Give Tuco one of your teeth.

event.text: Awkwardly, you do your best to pry one of your less useful teeth from your mouth, and eventually resort to using the classic string and door trick. Painful as it is, Tuco is immensely grateful and immediately leaves to begin working on stitching in your tooth.
Weirded out by the offer, you do your best to politely decline. Tuco is clearly disappointed but doesn't seem to be too offended.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_4
event.text: You hear a knock on the door to the cockpit and open it to find Tuco, who asks to enter. "Hello... captain..." Tuco runs his hands down his face, struggling to get his words out under a drunken stupor. "Can... I... uhm... the database? Fed. Database. See it... can I? Please?"

choice.text: Give him access to the database.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_4_ACCEPT
event.text: Tuco nods excessively and mumbles what you think is him saying thanks. He awkwardly sits himself in the chair next to you and pulls up the database with your help, and scrolls down to the T-section. He pulls up various articles regarding himself and scans the information. "I can't... ugh... my head hurts. I can't... this... reading. I will... AGH-" Tuco grabs his head. "Headache. I will read this... later. Goodnight." Tuco gets up and stumbles his way out the door and back to his quarters.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_4_REFUSE
event.text: "Blagh... what a load of... crap..." Tuco fumbles to imitate throttling himself, or perhaps you, then turns and stumbles out the door. You ignore his aggression and hope it'll go away once the hangover has passed.

choice.text: Ask him why he needs it.

event.text: "I want... AGH-" Tuco stumbles over, slamming against the wall. "Stupid... migraines..." Tuco rubs at his cranium, trying to restore his train of thought. "I want... to read what they've written about... me...?" You notice the uncertainty at the end of his statement.

choice.text: Give him access to the database.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GENERIC_5
event.text: You find Tuco drunk sitting in some odd corner of the ship, curled up in an awkward position with the broken cover to what you think was a ventilation shaft. As you aproach, he begins to shout random things at you but none of them make it through the translator. You decide now isn't the best time to talk and leave.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_NIGHTS_1
event.text: You stroll up to Nights, who is as always holding a drink in his hand, but smiling wider than normal. In his own words, he claims to have become much more "bearable" since he got a drinking buddy. You wonder who he's referring to until Tuco walks into the room, also holding a bottle, and toasts to Nights.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_NIGHTS_2
event.text: Having noticed that both Tuco and Nights have been missing for hours, you go looking for them. Eventually you find both of them passed out in the cargo bay, surrounded by empty beer bottles, and both of them partly undressed. You know you won't be able to wake either of them up any time soon, and set a reminder to check back in an hour.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_NIGHTS_3
event.text: While doing your regular patrol of the ship, you hear two bottles clink and turn to see Tuco and Nights sitting closely together in a closet. Tuco shouts to you, "Captain! Would you like to join us?", clearly not too enthusiastic about it but trying to be polite. Nights scowls but doesn't take back the offer.

You shrug and take a seat across from the two. Tuco pours you a shot and you all toast together and take a drink. The three of you make idle, rather awkward conversation until you eventually decide you've had enough and leave.
You decline the offer and briefly consider admnonishing them. Instead you decide to let them be and caution them not to drink too much.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_ARIADNE_1
event.text: Several of the crew are sitting together in the kitchen eating when Ariadne walks in. As soon as she enters, Tuco bows and slides a chair out for her. "My princess, please, would you have a seat?" He snickers and Ariadne scowls. "You call me a princess again and I'll pop your damn head off. We've known each other for years and you know damn well I ain't royalty." You expect some kind of standoff, but instead she smiles and sits down. "I will, however, kindly accept the seat."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_ARIADNE_2
event.text: Ariadne appears to be assembling some sort of explosive device in her room, while Tuco stands by holding a toolkit. You warn Ariadne against doing such dangerous things in the crew quarters, but she dismisses you. "The last time you told me that, you said I needed 'supervision' in case something went wrong. Now I have supervision." She points to Tuco who waves with his free hand. "If something goes wrong, it's my room that'll be blown up anyways. Assuming I survive the blast, I can sleep on the floor if it comes to that."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TUCO_GUNTPUT_1
event.text:
Whilst in the middle of recovering from a hangover, Tuco has planted himself in a booth in the ship's kitchen with the lights turned off. You notice a large pot with some liquid brewing and moments later Guntput barges in, carrying several weird herbs. He dumps them into the pot and stirs it. "GOD DAMN IT YOU BLOODY LIZARD, KEEP IT DOWN! I HAVE A HEADACHE!" Guntput says nothing, instead pooring some of the liquid into a bowl and dashing over to the irate Rockman. "You. Drink Guntput's liquid. Now."
Tuco pushes him aside. "I don't want your damn liquid, I have a hangover. Go away!" However, Guntput insists. "No. Drink." He scrambles onto the table and begins to force the liquid down Tuco's throat. You think things are about to get violent, but Tuco gives up and downs the bowl. "Good. This will help headache. You will thank Guntput later. You must stop drinking so much." Guntput leaps off the table and scurries away before Tuco can respond.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_NOTHING
event.text: Ariadne is tinkering with some explosives on her workbench, and ignores you as you enter the room. You try to speak to her but are cut off: "Go away. If you distract me I might blow us all to hell. Go bother someone else right now."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_1
event.text: "Statistically speaking, in the Multiverse there must be at least one reality in which the Elders have already been defeated. In fact, if I understand the science behind it, I believe there would in fact be infinite. Some people in my homeland would find it wise to tell me I should be satisfied with this. But that is utter nonsense. Just because a million, or a billion, or a trillion, or a blaze knows how many people have a better life doesn't mean I can't aspire to make the lives better for the people I know!" Despite the resoluteness of this statement, you feel an air of open-endedness to Ariadne's statement, as if she's expecting your opinion as well.

Ariadne seems content with your response. "Good. We are on the same page. As we should be, considering the aim of your mission. Let us both just hope we can make a change after all." Ariadne gets up, nods to you, and walks away.

"What? So you mean to suggest then I should just sit idly and allow millions of my fellow Rockmen and women to suffer at the hands of tyrants? Your logic is nonsense and it is clear to me you speak from instinct rather than intellect. Your very mission in which I have promised to help consists of taking direct action to better the lives of many despite the infinite multitudes of the Multiverse." Ariadne grumbles and walks away, although noticeably lacking a bit of her usual arrogant confidence.
You say nothing and instead nod along passively. Ariadne grumbles and walks away lacking a bit of her usual arrogant confidence.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_2
event.text: Ariadne spots you in the recreation room watching some of the other crew and takes a seat next to you. Weary she's trying to test you once again, you make sure to give her extra attention. "There is a school of thought popular within the Theocracy that suggests the... 'breeding class' - that being, women, ought not to wear the same rights as the men. That in fact, despite our near identical anatomies, we are different enough to warrant such exclusion." Ariadne pauses to allow you to process this information. "I would recommend, captain, if you have ever found yourself sharing these kinds of thoughts, that you discard them. And if you meet those who refuse to discard them their own, then I advise a swift exit of whichever room it is in which you had the displeasure of meeting them."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_3
event.text: You find Ariadne tinkering with the Weapons system. "Of the interiors of every ship I have yet seen, I have never seen one that contains so many randomly scattered missiles in my life. Why do you pile them haphazardly like you have? I am going to build you a shelf. And you will keep your missiles on the damn shelf. And if you don't, I will build you a fixture for your chair which will slap your face upon each hour of every cycle for the rest of our duration aboard this vessel."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_4
event.text: "The last person who called me princess, I smashed their head open with my fist." Ariadne scowls at you, despite you not having done anything.

"No. And that is why your head is not mush between my hands." She smiles, although you can't help but feel intimidated anyways. Although no extra words are spoken, it is clear the unspoken sentence is "Don't you dare ever call me princess or you'll be next."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_5
event.text: "I was mortified to find that some people find it apt to compare my Lost Suns to that of the Free Mantis and Duskbringers. To the first, I am not so much offended as confused. I cannot say I share a great afinity for the drug-obsessed Mantis, but I do not spite them either. But the Dusks? How is a democratic, justice driven revolution by the oppressed masses at all comparable to a fascist uprising by the bourgeoisie? When I find who started this, I will cause them great suffering. Perhaps I will strand them in a Dusk sector, so that they may experience first hand the difference. Hmph."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ARIADNE_GENERIC_6
event.text: "It is shameful that even now, so far into the future, we still suffer from the plights of sexism and homophobia. At least, in the Theocracy as it is. In other places it is perhaps different, but it seems to be the inclination of the religious masses that any group with less than a persistent drive to produce a shapeless army of new zealots must be oppressed and brainwashed. Anything less than a total, liberal institution must be abolished to achieve universal liberty. If I am still alive when the Lost Suns have acheived their victory, then I forsee myself to be one to carry this fate out." Ariadne's gaze shifts to you. "When the time comes, if it does come at all, then I advise you do not stand in my way. There is a great fire on the horizon, and nothing will be able to put it out once the match has been lit."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_VORTIGON_NOTHING
event.text: Vortigon is kneeled over before the ship toilet, hands clasped to his chest and making a strange sound. At first you consider he might have food poisoning, but you quickly realize he's praying. Knowing better than to disturb the Grand Priest in a moment of prayer, you'll have to talk to someone else.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_VORTIGON_GENERIC_1
event.text: "Your Federation ships are boring! Where is the flair? The colors? If you wish to be feared, you will need a better color scheme than paste with faded orange!" Vortigon crosses his arms, dissapointed.

choice.text: Hey, I didn't make the colors!

event.text: Vortigon keeps his arms crossed, but doesn't seem to have anything more to add. Seems you've put him at a loss for words.
"At least you can admit it! I look on with disgust at all these ships, and I see nothing that appeases me. This whole galaxy needs to be taught how to pick a color palette."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_NOTHING
event.text: You spot Rig talking to himself, and for a moment consider asking him if he's okay when you hear a rumbling sound from his stomach. You quickly realize he's having a conversation with Tintan and decide not to intrude. It's rare to see the pair getting along, so you'll have to find someone else to talk to.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_GENERIC_1
event.text: You hear a deep rumbling from Rig's stomach and ask if Tintan is doing okay. "Is Tan doing okay? She's stuck in my stomach, of course she isn't okay! Hmph." With a sneer, he comments further, "Just be glad you can't hear her like I can. The stream of insults and cursing is ceaseless. Even when I'm trying to sleep she keeps shouting at me. Some real wonderful 'symbiosis' we have going on, indeed."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_GENERIC_2
event.text:
"Rig and Tintan does sort of roll off the tongue, doesn't it? When everything's gone wrong, at least you have the little things to look to sometimes, you know?" Rig pauses as he gets feedback from Tintan on his little discovery.
"Well excuuuuse me for trying to have a bit of happiness in my life. You miserable little wench, I bet you were just as insufferable before this! At least people don't have to hear you whine now!" Another pause.
"BY THE CRYSTAL SPIRIT, YOU DID NOT JUST SAY THAT! YOU BITCH! I HOPE YOUR CHASSIS DISSOLVES IN STOMACH ACID!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_GENERIC_3
event.text:
Rig seems a bit perturbed. Well, more perturbed than usual. "You know, before this happened I used to go to church quite often. Chrysolity was a staple of my life. It made me a bit of an outsider in Zulfiqar, since most of those executive guys weren't too tied to their faith. Of course, everyone had to SAY they went to church, or else the Elders would have taken us down quick as lighting. But me? I was a faithful believer. But this? This makes me question if there is really any sort of benevolent entity out there. And if there is, why this? Why me?"
There's a pause as Tintan seems to be talking. "Oh great, thanks for the input Tan. I really just was dying to know that you thought I was a dumb shithead idiot because I went to church. Like no Zoltan ever has been religious. Not like you have a whole damn government-subsidized nebula full of monks or anything! The Ministry is practical a theocracy as well! Why do you think our species get along so well?" There's total and uncomfortable silence, as Tintan seems unable to retaliate.
"Yeah, shut you up did I?" Another rumble. "Oh go to hell."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_GENERIC_4
event.text: Despite the two never seeming to get along, you notice Rig still refers to Tintan as just 'Tan', almost affectionately. You could ask them about it, but it might set them off on another argument.

choice.text: Why do you call her Tan?

event.text: "You mean why the nickname? Oh, I dunno. Hard not to get at least a little attached to the woman living inside your stomach, even if she's an unbearable wench sometimes." He smiles. "She reminds me of most Rockmen I know. A stubborn asshole who can say the most offensive, insensitive things and yet still somehow be likable." He listens to the rumbling in his stomach. "Oh don't go soft on me now Tan. It just doesn't feel like you unless you end your sentence by calling me some new variation of a slur."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_GENERIC_5
event.text: Out of nowhere, Rig suddenly starts to scream. "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAH! OH MY GOD! AAAAAAAAAAH!"

"I just realized how messed up this all is! Oh my god, holy shit, this is disgusting! This is abhorrent! How the hell did we get here? I have a living person in my stomach and I'm just carrying on as if everything is NORMAL! THIS IS NOT NORMAL!" Rig falls to the ground and begins to sob. His stomach is silent, and if you had to guess Tintan is going through something similar. It is incredibly messed up, but hopefully as soon as the mission is over you can get them the medical attention necessary.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_BILLY_1
event.text:
One day, almost out of nowhere, Rig storms into the lounge where Billy is relaxing and hoists him up off the ground. "YOU DID THIS DIDN'T YOU?! YOU'RE RESPONSIBLE FOR RUINING MY LIFE! I JUST KNOW IT, YOU SLUG PIECE OF SHIT!"
Billy, although startled, isn't about to let this go without a fight. "HAH! Oh god I wisssh it wasss! Sssservess you right, Rockman! You know Hektar sssellsss the sssuperior productsss, but becaussse you have all that rich church money to pump up your marketing, you jussst got better exposssure! Of courssse you'd try and pin thisss on me! You think I'm the kind of assshole who'd ssstick two people up each other'sss assshole? Come on, I have more ssstyle than that! I might be cold but I'm not cruel! If my credit with Vael wasss any better I'd just have had you killed, ssssimple and painlesss."
Rig tosses Billy down in a heap, still seething but trying to calm down. "Right, forgot you were too busy trying to pay off your crippling debt to a serial murderer. Pffft, but really? Hektar selling better products? Hah! You wish! Zulfiqar sells reliable, affordable, and standardized equipment for ships of all kinds. Your modular shit is a short lived novelty for crack addicts and pirates! That hideous, eye-wrenching blue and yellow color scheme makes me want to puke! You keep telling yourself it was Zulfiqar that put you out of business if it's what lets you sleep at night - but deep down, you know it's just because your company isn't worth the crate of slime you evolved out of."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_TONY_1
event.text:
Tony and Rig are sitting across from each other, in the middle of a conversation. "Rig... how did you ever recover from the 'incident?'" "Recover? I wouldn't exactly say I 'recovered.'" "I mean, you seem fine enough. Functional-" "FUNCTIONAL? Tony, I have a ZOLTAN LIVING IN MY STOMACH! I am not okay in the slightest, every waking moment of my existence is pure misery and I don't even know why I haven't ended it yet!" "Well uhm... besides that, I mean. How did you cope after we were separated?" "I DIDN'T. I didn't cope at all! I could barely hold my job, I was depressed all the time, I had to go to therapy daily. 7 years isn't enough time to get over that kind of thing. A whole damn lifetime isn't enough! And this situation now certainly isn't helping." Tony seems to take this in. "So... you're saying that me being like this isn't my fault? That this is normal?" Rig shrugs. "Normal? Probably not. Your fault? Hell if I know. But you're not alone in this. If we walked away from that even remotely normal it'd have been a miracle. We're both still alive, we're rich as all hell... it could be worse."
The conversation continues, changing topic to other more trivial things like soap operas. You decide to stop listening and go back about your duties.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_SYMBIOTE_TONY_2
event.text: Rig approaches Tony suddenly, proposing a new idea. "I want to buy a ship, when this is all over." Tony is very confused. "A ship? Okay...?" "Yes, a ship. For the three of us. Hopefully when Tan and I are separated. We can call it something stupid, like 'The Unholy Mistake'. We'll fly it around, and go kill some Slugs probably." Tony seems pleased with this idea. "A Slug hunting gig doesn't sound too bad. But... let's not get genocidal here. We just kill the BAD Slugs, okay?" Rig nods. "Okay, deal. The bad Slugs. And maybe when it's all over, we can go crash the ship on one of those Leech suicide moons as a standing testament of our burning hatred of this existence." "Crash it with US on it?" Tony seems both frightened and excited by the idea." "Uhm... well it wasn't what I was thinking, but maybe. Hopefully, by then, we'll hate living at least a little bit less. To be honest, I kind of just want to name a ship 'Unholy Mistake'. We're rich enough to crash a couple dozen of them anyways."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_NOTHING
event.text: As you approach Ruwen in the hallway, he seems startled and turns to face you but relaxes when he realizes you're the captain. "By the crypt, you scared me! Sorry, I'm trying to get some sleep right now. Ever since I woke from stasis I've had a dreadful case of insomnia, and to remedy it I try to wander the halls. I got the advice from a friend I met on a diplomatic mission, actually! You aliens and your... creative solutions. I do hope to try and get some shut-eye before the mission carries on though, so if at possible I'd appreciate it if you left me alone for a while."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_GENERIC_1
event.text: "CARTYK!" Ruwen bangs a fist down on the table in front of him and clutches his arm in pain. He looks back up to you, embarassed. "Apologies for the foreign expletive... it's just these stiff joints captain! It's no secret cryosleep doesn't exactly... do wonders for the body. I forgot to do my stretches this morning and I am terribly regretting it! I think you'll get used to the random shouting in time, and again I do genuinely apologize! Just be glad your translator hopefully doesn't know what any of it means."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_GENERIC_2
event.text: You notice Ruwen's room is decorated by a number of odd trinkets from seemingly all over the galaxy. You won't have time to ask about all of them, but if you wanted to you could probably get at least one story out of Ruwen.

choice.text: What's the black and red armor?

event.text: "This? Oh, this was a gift from Kataaagingi, the owner of Tiiikaka. It was part of one of my... less successful, but more interesting diplomatic exursions. I was on a personal quest to convince the pirate lord to end the slave trade in Imperial space. The agreement DID happen, thankfully, but it didn't stop the enslavement of Crystals entirely. Unfortunately, the Theocracy is known to employ Tiiikaka quite often, and it has become common practice for Crystal slaves to serve on Inquisition vessels. Any Crystal not in Imperial space is still vulnerable, but at least Imperial space itself is safe. Mostly... and only from slavers... Mmm..." Ruwen scratches his chin uncomfortably. "The armor is cool though! It's made for a Mantis so I can't exactly wear it, and they pulled it off of a dead guy... but... well it looks cool on a shelf?"

"Now that, that is a fine piece of weaponry. Foreigners make such fascinating guns sometimes - I wish we Crystals had such craftmanship." Ruwen runs his large golden hand over the gun. "It was a gift from chairman Irwin in the EHG, as part of an agreement I made near the beginning of my career as ambassador! Some Clansmen had begun hunting my kind, as you would expect of course, and it was my task to put an end to it. Irwin was surprisingly diplomatic, though I hear he isn't chairman anymore. Unfortunate. I learned much of Slug culture from him!"

"Oh crypt, Irwin, yes! I forgot you were on this ship! My dearest apologies! However did you get the boot anyways? That... is the expression, yes?"
Irwin moans. "Ssssome basssstard betrayed me and threw me in the gutter! But let'sss not linger on it. It'sss been yearsss, and it'sss a ssssore sssubject ssstill." Ruwen nods. "Oh of course, of course! I didn't mean to upset you! Well, I'm glad you're still alive at least! You must teach me more about your kind at some point. I am truly so curious."

choice.text: What's the vaguely humanoid ball of trash?

event.text: "That? That's uhm... a bunch of trash that some Free Mantis bunched together into a shape that I think is meant to vaguely resemble myself. It wasn't part of a diplomatic mission, they just followed me around until I'd accept it. Oh, such strange creatures. I don't mean to sound rude but I am quite glad they seem to be the outliers. Oh, if we had reentered the galaxy only to find you were ALL of such... stup...er, creativity... I don't know what we'd do!"

choice.text: You still have the sculpture in your room though.

event.text: "Well, yes. It's quite endearing, no? Strange or not, I can't hate the creatures. They meant well, and fortunately the sculpture doesn't smell."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_GENERIC_3
event.text: "Captain, might I ask what species you like the least? I'm intending to collect data from all sorts of sources and compile a list to understand the effects of certain bias on how people interpret species!"

choice.text: I don't feel comfortable with this.

event.text: "What? Why not? Oh, is this another taboo in your culture? My apologies, it is not uncommon for my kind to talk about species in such manners. I will refrain from asking you such questions in the future."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_GENERIC_4
event.text: Ruwen notices a splotch of blue showing through his yellow skin paint. "Oh by Ycathine's crypt, I'm terribly sorry! This is so embarassing, I should go cover this up immediately!"

"Oh, right, this problem seems so strange to you. You see, some cultures find nudity to be taboo. In a similar vein, high ranking Imperial officials are forbidden from showing their bare skin in public. An ambassador, one of the most honorable positions, must always be coated in yellow. Even if you do not mind, I refuse to break such important tradition. I will go cover myself, goodbye captain."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_TURZIL_1
event.text: Turzil wanders over to Ruwen, who is applying a new coat of his yellow paint. "Observation: you have a stunning shade of yellow. That is my: favorite -shade- of yellow. Request: may I borrow some [paint]?" Ruwen scoots a bucket of paint over to Turzil carefully, warning him to be careful because it's a very special and expensive kind of paint. Turzil thanks him awkwardly and continues to stand there. "Er... I'm sorry strange robot thing, but I know very little about your culture. If you're attempting to flirt with me I'm afraid my heart already goes out to another woman! I hope you don't take offense..." Ruwen blinks but Turzil isn't responding. "Are... you okay?" He gets up and shakes Turzil a little, still without a response. Ruwen looks to you for help. "Captain, it seems the Engi shut himself down. I have no idea how these things work, but I fear this may require the attention of a medical professional or a technician, of which I am regretably neither."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_RUWEN_DIANESH_1
event.text: Dianesh approaches Ruwen, carrying a stack of letters which she lays in front of him. "Ruwen, why have you been sending me so many unsigned letters? You do realize we're both on the same ship...?" "Uh... uhm... I don't know what you mean, Empress! If someone is sending you mysterious letters, it could be anyone!" "Ruwen, you've been using the Imperial stamp on all of them. There's literally only two people on this ship who own that stamp, and that's us." "Oh... oh. Uhm. Did you read the letters?" "No, not yet. I have no idea what they're about, but I'm just confused why you're sending them." "DON'T READ THEM!" Ruwen scoops up all of the letters and rushes to the airlock, where he dumps them all out into space. "Oh crypt, that was a close one... phew..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_NOTHING
event.text: Dianesh bows as you approach, and you bow in return on instinct. You expect her to say more, but when no response comes, you awkwardly wave hello. "Do you have no question in mind for me?" She sighs. "I'm afraid I'm not one for unprompted small talk. As Empress it's my duty to maintain my regal posture, but rarely is it my duty to chat. With such limited conversation topics on both of our minds, why don't you speak with someone else today?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_GENERIC_1
event.text: "There are few terrors that can keep me up at night more than the pitiful fact that my species's history has been lost not only once but TWICE! Again and again we are struck with tragedy, a genocide of legacy." Dianesh says all of this, but doesn't elaborate on either incident.

"The first happened eons ago. Exactly when, I couldn't tell you, since that history is lost. It involves the great emperor Ycathine, who served rule during what is believed to be the darkest period of our history. At the end of a terrible civil war, which left the species divided across the galaxy, he swore to seal himself away with all remains of that war forever. This tale has since been mythologized as the tale of Ycathine's Crypt, and most don't even seem to believe it's real." Dianesh waits a few moments, then smiles smugly. "However, as Empress, I'm privy to a bit more information than the common man. While I don't know for ceerrrrrtain that it's real... I have no reason to suspect it isn't, either. Now, enough chatter. If I speak too long about the past, I'll forget the present even exists."

"You already know the second. When we were forced to leave our homeworlds by the savage invasion of pioneers, we left behind countless relics and landmarks that simply couldn't be taken with us. I can only imagine what travesties have defaced them now." Dianesh sighs. "Some day, we will return and take back those lands. Even if we don't remain in seclusion, there is much heritage that we must recover unless we are simply to forget the last century entirely. Now, enough chatter. If I speak too long about the past, I'll forget the present even exists."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_GENERIC_2
event.text: You spot Dianesh taking some strange powder from a vial. She coughs a few times and shivers once she has it down, then notices you watching her. "Don't you have better places to be than spying on me?"
"What is what stuff?" Dianesh scowls and stashes the vial in her pocket.

choice.text: That vial of power you just took.

event.text: "Hmph. So I was not as careful at hiding it as I thought. I didn't expect nosy captains to be sticking their face in my 'private' quarters. Fine. It's Riapel. The stimulant we Crystals use to accelerate geode growth. The health affects on Crystal biology are minimal, but it has somewhat of an addictive effect. If you don't use it for too long after a steady dose of it, like all drugs, you experience withdrawals." Dianesh says nothing else about it, as if the rest is obvious. You can tell she doesn't like talking about it.

choice.text: But why are you taking it right now?

event.text: Dianesh's scowl grows even more spiteful. "Because I am experiencing withdrawals. Are you always so clueless? Because if I'm going to have to spell everything out for you, then this is going to get real tiring real fast." You mumble an apology and leave before things get more tense.

"A-Am I a drug addict?! Wow, what tact you have. I hope you're as frank to all your friends, because you must truly be their favorite person to hang out with." Dianesh folds her arms. "I don't know, AM I a drug addict? I take the same stimulant every other damn Crystal does, just a bit more of it. Since you just love asking questions you have no right to ask, why don't you ask me everything else about my life, huh? Am I a virgin? What's my favorite fetish? Do I hide dead bodies in my closet?"

Dianesh walks up to you, grabs you by the neck, and flings you out of her room. "Get the hell out of my room, and STAY out of it. Or else next time I'll teach you what it feels like to have a piece of rock lodged in your forehead."

choice.text: Are there dead bodies in your closet?

event.text: Dianesh walks up to you, grabs you by the neck, and flings you out of her room. "Get the hell out of my room, and STAY out of it. Or else next time I'll teach you what it feels like to have a piece of rock lodged in your forehead."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_GENERIC_3
event.text: "The life of a Crystalline Empress is a hard one. I had to undergo vigorous, constant training not only from my mother on all the obscure etiquettes I would need but also my father. You see, a Crystalline Empress is also functionally a warrior queen. I am the head of state and chief military commander, and so I am expected to be a competent warrior myself." Dianesh doesn't seem to find this memory pleasant, but keeps going anyways. "I am the first female head of state in the Empire for nearly 13 centuries. Most didn't expect highly of me. I've always had the extra burden on my back of having to prove to everyone I'm worth remembering in history for more than just the novelty of being female. I am not just an 'Empress'. I want to be a part of history, forever. I want to be remembered for MY accomplishments, and not just the circumstances of my birth."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_GENERIC_4
event.text: "My people have never been too particularly attached to their faith. There has always been religion, but it is a footnote of our history. Never did I feel too strongly about it until I witnessed just what the Theocracy used it for. Having known what it feels like to be revered as a goddess, I now know for certain there can be no god. No higher being with any dignity would allow their image to be disgraced by the sorts of egregious means of worship and oppression comitted in their name. If I had the power to strike the Elders down like they so claim, then I would have done so ten times over. No person should ever be forced to endure such machiavellian psycological shackles."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_GENERIC_5
event.text: Out of curiosity, you ask Dianesh just how the Elders managed to erase all memory of Crystals from the galaxy. "Hmph. I was wondering when you might ask. It is a common misconception among foreigners that the Rockmen and Crystals lived closely together throughout all of the Rock-Crystal Empire. Our two civilizations were spread apart by the length of several systems, and we Crystals have always been isolationists. The Elders didn't have to try hard to chase us away, because we were barely here to begin with. Most galactic civilizations were still fledgling and had barely interacted with us at the time. Most probably assumed we were just a mutation, or they had imagined us, if they even knew we existed at all."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_ARIADNE_1
event.text:
"So, I take it you are Empress Dianesh then." Ariadne takes a seat across from Dianesh, and the two women stare at each other a bit uncomfortably. "Yes, I am her, and she is me. You are... the Lost Sun Admiral. I apologize if I forgot your name." "Ariadne." Ariadne announces her name with a piercing effect, making sure Dianesh never forgets it. The air between them is tense, although not necessarily hostile. "So, have you come here to tell me I am another corrupt, evil autocrat who's rule must be expunged from the face of existence like the Elders? If that is your intent then I advice you just cut to the chase and say it." Ariadne shakes her head. "On the contrary. I came to say I have a lot of respect for you, girl, both personally and in your leadership. I'm a revolutionary but I'm not a radical. I know you were born into this, you didn't seize this power yourself. From what I can tell you seem to be doing a good job. I know you have your people's wellbeing in your heart and mind at all times, and that's ultimately what matters most in a leader."
Dianesh nods, although a bit confused. "Uhuh... Well I am pleasantly surprised to hear that then. Your men haven't been the most... polite to mine, with all that feuding between the Suns and the SSLG. But really, I assure you, my intent is not just to extend my power. If you want a Rock democracy, by all means you can have it. We are two distinct species now, and I have no delusions about it. But I do think there are many benefits to a renewed sistership between us. One where we are equals, and not the basis of a religion." "Good. I'm not a fan of imperialism, but I'm sure we can make something work. But if you double cross me, I will-" Dianesh cuts her off. "You will what, crush my head with your own bare hands? No need to finish that sentence, because I was only going to tell you the same." The two women smile at this mutual understanding and shake hands.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_SLOCKNOG_1
event.text:
"Hello dear Empressss! Tisss a good day for monarchy, to have two sssuch prominent and powerful leadersss united on thisss vesssel!" Slocknog nods to Dianesh and pulls his special lighter out from his pocket and lights a cigarette, then offers one to the empress. Dianesh considers the roll for a few moments before turning it down reluctantly. "I... appreciate the sentiment, yellow Slug." Slocknog stops her. "Sssslocknog." He extends his tentacle, which Dianesh shakes without much force. "Right, Slocknog. As I was saying. I appreciate the sentiment, but... well I'm quite confused. The Kleptocracy does not have monarchs. You talk so much about bloodlines and legacy... but Slugs don't have that anymore. I vaguely remember the ancient days of the Clairvoyant Empire, but that empire vanished by the time my kind reemerged into the galaxy."
Slocknog is speechless. "Uhm... well... uh... It'sss a bit of an unconventional approach to monarchy, yessss. But we have to make due sssometimesss with what the left handssss usss sssometimesss, yesss?" "The... left? I don't understand what you mean." "Yessss, the left. You know, the liberal essstablissshment. Any good leader knowssss compromissse isss necessssary, but ssssometimesss thessse liberalssss really get on my nervesss. They're trying to change too much at oncccce, too much reform will dessstabilizzze the nation! It'ssss clear if you follow hissstory, the passst wasss alwaysss better." "I... what are you talking about? It sounds like if people are trying to constantly reform the Kleptocracy, you clearly have issues that need reform. If so people want change for the better, why not give it to them? I don't know much about Kleptocracy politics, but I do know there seems to be a lot of turmoil over there right now."
"Nevermind. Sssshould have known better not to get into politicssss again. Pfft, a leftisssst monarch? Never thought I'd ssssee the day..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DIANESH_MISSILE_1
event.text: You find Dianesh in the cargo bay, staring at one of the missile launchers that's currently under calibration. It takes a few moments before you realize it's the Dianesh Missiles. "It disgusts me to see my name used in such a way."

choice.text: Having a weapon named after you?

event.text: "What? No. That, I couldn't mind in the slightest. I mean being an entity of such high worship. I don't want to be a goddess. I think you will find no leader who does not host a... refined ego, but I am not so delusion I think of myself as divine. I am as mortal as Ycathine, and I desire the same judgement as him. If the greatest emperor my people ever had was worshiped by no one, then neither should I."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_NIGHTS_NOTHING
event.text: You spot Nights and cautiously approach him to try and talk, but as soon as you utter your first word he starts flailing his arms and yelling. "Yaaaagh! Sssshutttuppp! I. AM. HUNG. OVER. With whatever kingly powersss I ssstill hold I demand you leave me alone. And fetch me a- *hiccup* pain killer while you're at it!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_NIGHTS_GENERIC_1
event.text: You hear the sound of shouting and several clangs above you, and look up to see the gelatinous end of Nights's body dangling from a vent in the ship. "SSSHIT! I'm SSSTUCK! CAN ANYONE HEAR ME?"
"LOOK, I KNOW WHAT THISSSS LOOKSSS LIKE. BUT RESSSERVE YOUR LAUGHTER FOR LATER WHEN I CAN SSSLAP YOU AND GET ME OUT!"

"I GOT DRUNK AND WANDERED INTO AN AIRVENT ON ACCCIDENT OKAY? I USSSSE THEM TO AVOID HAVING TO TALK TO PEOPLE WHEN I'M MOVING BETWEEN ROOMS BUT I'M USUALLY SSSOBER ENOUGH TO AVOID THISSSS!" You tell Nights to 'hang on' while you go and get a ladder and some other crew to help out.

choice.text: Say nothing and let him dangle.

event.text: "CAN ANYONE HEAR ME?! GOD DAMN IT I AM YELLING, I KNOW YOU SSSHITSSS CAN HEAR ME!" Nights continues to scream to no avail as you walk away.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_NIGHTS_GENERIC_2
event.text: Despite the loud, obnoxious, and disheveled mess that Nights seems to currently be, apparently once long ago he was a feared and respected pirate captain. It's hard to believe, but maybe you can get him to tell you a bit about it while he's more sober?

"Why the hell do you care?" Nights slams down his empty bottle on the floor and rolls over on his couch so he can glare at you. "Fine. You want to hear a frickin story or whatever? Oncccce upon a god damn time there wasss a perky Ssslug who thought he was invincccible and sssailed the cosssmosss trying to make a name for himsssself, jussst like hisss heroesss. Piratesss were like cccelebritiess back then. Tuco, Kazaaakplethkilik, everybody knowsss 'em and everybody lovesss 'em. But life asss a pirate ain't easssy. You gotta maim, you gotta kill, you gotta be a brute. And Mr. Invincccible realizzzed he ain't a killer. A ssswindler sssure, but he never had the spirit of ruthlessss killing."
Nights picks up his bottle again and tips it upside down, trying to get the last drop out. He gives up eventually and tosses it back down and groans. "Mr. Invincccible getsss a gang together, buysss a fancccy ship with daddy'sss gambling money, and makes a bit of a name for himssself assss a gentleman pirate. One with brainsss and wit who'll rob the daylightssss out of anyone who dessservesss it but wouldn't hurt a fly unlesss he had a reassson. He getsss real popular, and friendsss ssstart telling him he ought to be a politician! Makess sssensssse. Everybody wassss tired of Ssslocknog and his conssservative, traditionalissst idealsss. Nationalissst fervor dessstabilizzzed the nation and sssent a bunch of haplessss kidsss off to die against a bunch of tapewormsss and geode worssshipping clergymen in sssome ssstupid aimlesss war. And with Mr. Invincccible being sssuch a new liberal thinker, and a popular one at that, why ssshouldn't he lead the Kleptocraccccy?"
Nights chuckles, lost in some deep irony only he understands. "Mr. invincccible thought it'd be fun. Thought politicssss would be asss much an adventure as being a pirate. And who could blame him? The god damn 'election' cccycle involvessss a bunch of moronssss raccing to sssteal sssome sssstupid ssshitty crown. It'sss a mockery, but it'sss a sssacred tradition. A compromissse invented after the fall of the Clairvoyant Empire over a cccentury ago. And when he got that crown it felt like the galaxy wassss falling apart. Within a week the former king had been chasssed into exile and Mr. Invincccible was on top of it all. He wasss king! And it wassss terrible. There was no adventure. No dazzling misssionss of death-definy glory. Just a bunch of ssstuffy clownsss in sssuits and gownsss trying to get him to sssign thissss and that. They told him there wasss plenty of fun to be had. The partiesss. Not much a partier he wasss before he wasss king. But the boozzze and the drugsss and the sssex, it wasss the only thing left that could ssstimulate the russsh of the old daysss. And sssso he got lossst in it. Devoured by the temptation to fill the void, he became a ssshadow of what he onccce wasss. A mockery of both a pirate and a politicccian. Cccertainly not a king."
Nights mimmicks a bow, laughing sadistically as he does. "And there you go Renegade! There's your pirate ssstory. I hope it wasss asss exccciting and daring asss you had hoped it to be! Hah! Now leave thissss old wassshed up asssshole to hisss boozzze and ssstop reminding him of what onccce wasss."
