I doubt someone like you would have enough control over your cognitive functions to inhibit lust and love. I'm a scientist and a genius, I'm more qualified about thhhis thhhan you are, asshole. Just... get out of my room."

Alkali doesn't seem comforted at all by your agreeance. "You're only agreeing because you were probably hurt real bad by some whore in a brothhhel somewhere. I've reached thhhis conclusion through years of careful analysis and scientific thhheory. I don't just THHHINK love is bad, I have PROVEN it. Now, get out of my room."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKALI_OOJ_1
event.text: You catch Alkali eyeing OOJ, who is wiggling pointlessly in the middle of the hallway. "Look at it. Biological perfection, thhhe ultimate weapon, thhe ultimate utility. It was created to phase out an entire generation of worthhhless nothhhings. You're very lucky, Renegade, you have bothhh thhhe greatest biological marvel aboard your ship AND its creator."

choice.text: OOJ isn't an 'it', or a weapon. He's a person too.

event.text: "AHAHAHAHAHAH! HAHAHAHAH! Oh. You're not joking. God what are you, some kind of humanitarian? Some pro-life bullshit propagandist? IT was born in a lab, made in a test tube. Thhhhings born in labs are not PEOPLE. Unless thhhey're Shells. Or uh... the vitro-fertilized. Okay maybe you have a point. But only maybe. I will conduct a greater hypothhhesis on thhhhis later, if only just to prove you wrong."

"Good, I was getting afraid you weren't going to respond. It's not often people outside of my laboratory staff get to interact with me, so take in thhhe view and stunning genius of my commentary while you can. It won't last forever!" Alkali rolls away.
Awkwardly, Alkali laughs to himself. "Yep... real lucky..." Alkali rolls away, not sure what to make of your silence.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKALI_OOJ_2
event.text: You catch OOJ and Alkali deep in a conversation, speaking gibberish back and forth. You're fairly surprised to see this, because as far as you knew no one could understand what they're saying. Though, if anyone could, it makes sense to be Alkali.

choice.text: You know what the Morphs are saying, Alkali?

event.text: Alkali turns to you, annoyed by your interuption. "What? No. I never finished pathhhing thhhe right neurons for thhhem to communicate properly. It's baffling thhhey can 'speak' at all. I'm probing for patterns, some kind of indication it's a real language they're speaking and not nonsense. Thhhe results are inconclusive... but not discouraging. If I can't crack thhhis damn code, thhhere's no one else in thhhe Multiverse thhhhat can! So go away and let me concentrate. Thhhhis isn't an easy or quick process."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKALI_FREDDY_1
event.text: Alkali rolls up to Freddy and begins observing him silently as he drinks his tea. Freddy stares back for a few moments before he puts down his saucer. "Pardon my intrusion, but might I inquire what it is you're uhm... Doing? "Observing. You're quite thhhhe strange specimen. All prior Mantis I have observed are incredibly unintelligent, to a comedically distressing degree. You, however, appear to be at least of an average intelligence. Would you mind if I dissected your brain later to discover what genetic mutation occured thhhat lifted your IQ from thhhhat of a potato?" "Well that's quite rude. Are you always like this, or do you just have something against my species?" "Oh nonsense, I view all barbarian species equally. Thhhey all serve places in thhhe galaxy, but I hardly thhhink you should mind my gentle prodding. I find Mantis often admire my vast intellect!" Freddy says nothing more to Alkali but turns to you. "Where did we find this asshole again? And may I vent him?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKALI_ARIADNE_1
event.text: You hear a high pitched scream come from the other end of the ship and rush to find the source. When you arrive, you find Ariadne has grabbed Alkali by the arm and is holding him in the air. As he squirms and squirms to be let free, Ariadne glowers at him. When Alkali notices you've arrived he pleads for you to help. "Please, thhhhe vicious brute has gone mad and is trying to kill me! Tell it to let go at once! Thhhe Multiverse cannot afford to lose my genius!" You glance up at Ariadne who grunts. "This little mold sport just thought it funny to call me a man because I was ugly. I thought I should smash his face open with my fist, but maybe he'd rather I throw him out the window instead." Alkali speaks up, as if insulted Ariadne should insinuate such a thing. "Oh nonsense, I made no such claim! I requested thhhe knowledge as to if your species were hermaphrodites. I know very well you are a woman, but as thhhe Slugs go, gender is but a social construct inherited from thhhe Union! I was merely wondering since you do take on thhhe appearance of a male and-" Ariadne smacks Alkali against the ground and kicks him against a wall, where he lays in a daze. Though tempted to allow Ariadne to continue beating him up, you can't afford to let her kill him and reluctantly ask her to calm down.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKALI_ELLIE_1
event.text: Ellie and Alkali are sat next to each other in the break room, with a diagram in front of them. Alkali seems to be trying to explain something about inheritance and alleles to Ellie using the diagram, but instead she's doodling a horse on the paper with a pink crayon. Unlike his typical behavior however, Alkali doesn't seem annoyed, if not perhaps a bit exasperated by his lack of understanding of her behavior. "You are... remarkably unconventional, professor Ellie. N-not that that's a bad thing! We need unconventional science to build the future, and you've done marvelous work with your Quarp Juice! It's just... I was wondering if you had your own thoughts to add on my research. There are few scientists who opinions I respect enough to review my work, but yours I most certainly do!" "Ssshh... Ellie's drawing a horsie!" "Yes, yes... but after you're done drawing the Equinoid, could you look over my paper?" "Sure thing! Ellie'll do anything for a fan!" Alkali seems relieved. "Good, good! Well I won't disturb you in the meantime..." Alkali rolls away, taking one last long look at Ellie as he goes.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_NOTHING
event.text: "Oh heavens! You startled me captain! Sorry, I was about to start meditating. It helps calm my anxiety. Maybe we can talk later, then?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_GENERIC_1
event.text: Tyrdeo slithers past, humming a song in his native language that doesn't pass well through your translator. Curious about it, you ask him what the song is. "Oh, this little tune? It's just one from my childhood! We used to sing it on the playground as kids! So much nostalgia..."

"Oh, it's the song the revolutionaries sang when they murdered Oertiss! It's about passing around the embalmed segments of his organs. The third and fourth melody are about the story of an argument about who got his liver!" Tyrdeo doesn't seem to think this sort of song is inappropriate for children, and goes back to singing as he carries on his way.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_GENERIC_2
event.text: Strangely, several portraits of Tyrdeo have been mysteriously appearing around the ship, decorating various hallways and rooms. It's frankly obvious who's hanging them up, but you aren't sure what you want to do about it.

"Oh... I uh... heh... uhm..." Tyrdeo seems caught off-guard, unsure how to justify his narcissism. "Sorry, I've been practicing my painting. It's hard to do gardening aboard a spaceship so I wanted to find other venues of artistic expression. I'll uh... I'll take the paintings down. I'm sorry." Tyrdeo seems genuinely apologetic and slithers away to go take care of the situation.

You pull the paintings off the wall and start stacking them in a pile. While the technique seems a bit amateur, you can tell painstaking effort went into each of them. Tyrdeo eventually notices you taking them down and stares woefully at the pile, not having enough courage to do anything about it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_GENERIC_3
event.text: "I think some species are quite strange in the characteristics they look for in a leader!" Tyrdeo shakes his head. "The Republic has been down on its luck - I swear, I was trying! - but I find the leaders of more functional nations to still be quite silly! What do people see in Lumei or Wentworth or..." Tyrdeo hesitates his next words. "Well... Nights, I guess. I don't want to slander my ally but... he's a bit gruff, you know? It sure was nice to have another leader in that room who was gay, but god did he drink like the world was about to end!" You can tell if you don't stop him now, Tyrdeo's about to open the floodgates to ranting.

"And god did he smell! He smelled terrible, awful, truly miserable. I heard he was once quite attractive and cunning back in the day. I got see that Gregory at least a little bit, but things sure went downhill fast! The excesses of the Kleptocracy, it's ridiculous how much they waste! Spending billions funding government-run pleasure cruises and casinos and bars, and... and they drink and they gamble and by god! How do they manage to stay afloat? The Kleptocracy should be in ruins like the Republic if they've really been running themselves this way all this time! It's a shame Slocknog thought it wise to invade us, because I had heard great things about him before that!"

"And Nights wasn't even the worst of them! When he wasn't absolutely wasted I actually appreciated his wit sometimes, he could be quite funny and charming! But god, Toarde? The Rockman? By the sweet heavens was he ever a snooze! Always talking about the next move, the next plan, the next battle, bla bla bla. Business, business, business. No rapport, and I swear by golly did I try to have some! Nights and Leik and I would go off on outings sometimes, spend time in each other's nations, get to know each other - but Toarde never came! He's just an unbearable asshole, and the atrocities he comits in his homeland?! It's despicable! I thought the Coalition was supposed to be about a new and better future for the galaxy, but if Toarde was in charge, there sure wouldn't be anything better in his galaxy! Leik was nice though. I could always tell she had more underneath her charisma, trying to weasel what she wanted out of everything, but who can blame her? She never trusted Nights and Nights never trusted her, but she was always gushing with me! Maybe it was because the Republic sided with the Hive during the Federation-Mantis war? Not many did, besides the Confederacy."

"It's funny, now that I think about it. How casual our meetings were whenever Toarde was out on some other business. Nights was such a party-goer, Leik was always so forthcoming and kind, and I'm certainly not against a bit of fun every now and then... you'd almost think we were friends! And... maybe in another life we could have been? I don't have many friends! It was so nice. I was always aware I was only there by circumstance... just a stroke of luck. I know they were pulling my strings, getting me to do what they wanted. But if that's what it takes to save the Republic then I'll do what I must! I'll do anything to save the Republic, to save my people! I was a good President, god damn it! I did everything I could! I may not be the brightest but I'm no Oertiss, Aerkae, or Kaero!" Tyrdeo starts to break down, but collects himself enough to not cry in front of you. "Oh heavens, I'm very sorry captain! I've been talking for quite a while... I'll go now."

choice.text: Tell him you have to go.

event.text: "Oh! Of course, captain. Well, I'll see you around sometime then! Bye bye!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_GENERIC_4
event.text: "Do you think maybe we could hire some servants, captain? To assist with preparing food and making our beds and you know, pointless manual labor? I can't imagine they're too costly, maybe only a salary of a couple hundred scrap for a cheap one. We'd need at least 4 or 5, of course, but it would be manageable, right? Right?" You say nothing, instead staring at Tyrdeo to determine if he's joking or not. "Right... well, I'll take this uncomfortable silence as a no then. Sorry for the trouble. Heheh..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_GENERIC_5
event.text: "I've heard the Confederacy has a little movement going on, trying to rally support to join the Coalition. I did always wonder if that was going to happen, since the Confederates did support the Hive during the war. What a strange and volatile place we live in. Do you ever think of other galaxies, and what they're like? We have all this fancy Multiverse travel and yet no one's ever been to another galaxy. I'm no spaceologist or astronomologist or whatever they're called but I do think about it quite often. What if we're living in the bad galaxy? Hmmm..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_TURZIL_1
event.text: Tyrdeo slithers up to you in the break room and takes a seat across from you. "I don't mean to sound gossipy here but I'm simply quite curious... about that Engi we have aboard. Turzil, yes? He's so very... peculiar? I'm familiar with all shades of peculiar of course, but it's... well hmm how do I say this. He's not very social, is he?"

"Well, I heard he was aspiring in some form of art. I happen to be rather partial to a portrait or two of myself, and I asked if he might paint me! He said yes, although somewhat reluctantly, and he just kept apologizing the whole time that he wouldn't do a good job! The poor boy, heavens, I wasn't trying to intimidate him. Then when he was finished and gave me the painting I told him it was beautiful, which was certainly no lie, and he just shut down! Dear... I don't believe I said anything wrong to him." Tyrdeo shakes his head. "Hmmm, Engi. Such strange creatures. Never met one quite like him though."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TYRDEO_OOJ_WEALSEY_1
event.text: A ruckus of screaming from the other room leads you to Tyrdeo with his tongue plunged deep into OOJ's squishy and slimy body, fishing around and tugging. "HELP! HELP! OH GOD OH HEAVENS THE MONSTER HAS EATEN MY DEAR WEALSEY! MY PRECIOUS BIRD! Please captain, help me! Heeeeelp!" Tyrdeo begins to sob, still struggling to fish the bird from out of OOJ.

You stand next to Tyrdeo and reach your arm into OOJ, fishing around in the suspiciously spacious cavern within. You feel all sorts of sharp metal, or maybe glass, what might be part of a Mantis exoskeleton, and many more things you can't even begin to guess at. Finally, you feel a plump and squishy, bird-like object and grab it, pulling Wealsey out from the gelatinous Morph. For having just been eaten, Wealsey looks surprising okay, and flutters to the top of Tyrdeo's head and tweets. "Oh sweet grace be this day. I thought I had lost him forever! Thank you captain. Why- why do let this thing roam the hallways? It's dangerous!" OOJ jiggles again, as if insulted. "Parra para tik spikle mika pallajoo! Piss."

choice.text: Tell OOJ to spit Wealsey out.

event.text: "Pakook malahoo kooj kooj!" OOJ vibrates and wiggles, and moments later spits out a yellow blob onto the floor. For having just been eaten, Wealsey looks surprising okay, and flutters to the top of Tyrdeo's head and tweets. "Oh sweet grace be this day. I thought I had lost him forever! Thank you captain. Why- why do let this thing roam the hallways? It's dangerous!" OOJ jiggles again, as if insulted. "Parra para tik spikle mika pallajoo! Piss."

Admist your cruel teasing Tyrdeo continues to pull. Somehow, whether it's OOJ reaching an understanding of the situation or just random chance, the grey blob decides to finally release the bird from his grasp. Wealsey seems surprisingly okay and tweets in greatings to his Leech father, who lifts the bird cautiously and places him between his crown and slithers away without glancing back at either of you.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_NOTHING
event.text: Alkram is laying in shock in his room. At first, he doesn't respond to you, but eventually you get his attention. "Why are you snapping at me? Can't you see I'm having a moment... When you get to be my age, and have seen the things I've seen, sometimes you need to just... stop for a while and think. And that thinking means not being disturbed."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_1
event.text: Alkram seems particularly bothered by some thought of his, and angrily vents in your general direction but not necessarily to you specifically. "Bah, the purity and will of the public conscience is a myth. What this galaxy needs is a set of strong leaders who aren't tainted by democratic notions and have the strength and intelligence to lead us! And I don't mean some bourgeoisie monarchist flakes like Leiiikonpliiinakra or the Elders. I mean someone capable and competent! Those Shells seem to have the right idea. I can't say I'm a fan of their eugenics, but their leadership selection portrays an immense wisdom..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_2
event.text: "There are days when I regret the side I took in the Federation-Mantis War. There are days I regret my history as a war-hero. There are many days I mourn the lives of all I took. There are countless days I think of the soldiers that I couldn't save. But there is never a day I regret being a part of the Eargen Republic. We are a divided and downtrodden people, but beneath our endless depression there is a great culture and spirit that is all but lost. We must fight to reclaim it. My ideal Republic is no Federation member, this is true. But it is not of the Coalition either. I think our people simply need some isolation, to ponder our national identity and the values we used to stand for so long ago. And when we have, only then shall we emerge from this darkness as a new, vigorous nation full of life and wellbeing for the galaxy. It is a shame I could not be the one to bring us this future."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_3
event.text: "In my observations of your behavior I have noticed you lack a great deal of the discipline one would look to find in a good soldier. You lack the uniform and, I think, the nationalist spirit I would expect to see too. Yet, I see the heart and the spirit of one. Tell me captain, do you see yourself as a soldier?"

choice.text: Yes, I am a soldier of the Federation.

event.text: "I see. I suppose this bears true in both a metaphorical and litteral sense. You do fight for the Federation, although you are a part of no platoon or squadron. Still, I have a great respect for any man or woman who serves a great debt to their nation. Even in my enemies, I can hold no ill will if they fight with true valor for a value they believe in. Such is what a soldier must be."

choice.text: Yes, but a soldier of no allegiance.

event.text: "Hm. Then not a good soldier are you? A soldier is one who fights for a cause, whatever that cause might be. I suppose it's in the name, yes? 'Renegade'. One without an allegiance. But are you then, I wonder, really a soldier at all? Or are you just another soul wandering this cosmos with no true purpose? Fighting for anything that seems right in the moment, but never finding a true ground to believe in. Not to say I know the answer, because I don't. And I doubt you do either. But this is the kind of reflection one must make to really find themself."

"And so scornfully you speak of it! At least, I must assume so for such a strong willed opinion. Yes, I know the type. I am, really, in no position to argue. I am proud to be a soldier, but I would not be proud to bring shame on someone else for not preferring the label."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_4
event.text:
"There was a dark time in my life when I fell into much the same pit as my Leech brethren. This was shortly after we lost the war, when it felt like the Republic had done the impossible and fallen from grace when it hadn't even had any to begin with. I felt so much shame for who I was and my actions, and so I turned to dark avenues. It never reached, perhaps, the same lengths as many of my kind. But alcohol has a certain allure that seems to draw in and unite all the lost and poor souls in this galaxy. And so I became a drinker. I quit the military and subsided into history, to be forgotten as just another foolish man who thought he had a place in this galaxy. That was, until the Kleptocracy invaded. I could stand the Chrysolic practioners and their invasive monasteries. It was slanderous to our culture, sure, but we Leeches were never a spiritual folk before anyways. But such a brazen attack from an alien foe? I was drawn back into the fray."
Alkram blinks, realizing he's been rambling a bit longer than he had anticipated. "What I mean to say, if you are to take the advice of this old general, is what we think we want and what reality shows us we need to be often lacks symmetry. Every man and woman has a purpose, but that purpose ought to be realized only when we're willing to see it."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_5
event.text: "I could have been a poet. Or an author. I studied litterature a bit, and it fascinated me. The way people commanded words was facsimile to troops on a battlefield. In the command of a strategic and skilled author, language can be deployed with as much deadly precision and destructive - or constructive - power as the greatest militaries in the Multiverse. But it was not to be my calling. War had other ideas. And so I put down my pen and traded it for sword, and the rest is history."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_GENERIC_6
event.text: "During the Mantis War I had gained little respect and lost plenty for the Confederacy. At that time the Vampweeds seemed disorganized and weak willed. I foresaw their hasty and shameful surrender long before it happened, signing some document of false peace with the Gathering to bail on the war and leave us all to burn. But I can see under the reforms of this new Premier, Arke'y, they have become as proud and strong a nation as the Eargen Republic once was in its glory days. Perhaps their ideals are not for me, but that is irrelevant as long as they stay true to them. If this was the Confederacy I had fought alongside in the war, I think just maybe victory would have been our glory to reap."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ALKRAM_ARIADNE_1
event.text:
Alkram approaches Ariadne, flaring his muscles with electric currents in an effort to appear even tougher and more grissled than usual. "So you are the Rockwoman I have heard so much about! How proud I am to serve aboard this vessel with another with such great revolutionary spirit!"
Ariadne slowly turns away from her work to look at the Leech. "You and I are about as similar as fire is to coffee. I turned away from the life of a princess in the house of one of the most powerful men in the entire known Multiverse to fight in mud and trenches to free people who don't even know they're enslaved from a brutal dictatorship led by 5 of the most cunning and murderous monsters in all of history. YOU are an aging veteran who fought on the side of a tyranical Hive mind in some long-gone war and got bored of eating batteries in a retirement home, so you incited the latest of some dozen revolutions in a fractured Republic against a ditzy and eccentric gardener who's greatest crimes were being culturally insensitive to a flower and using political gain as a cover to making friends."
With each word Ariadne makes a violent jab towards Alkram, who reels back in shock from the sudden hostility. There's a few moments of awkward silence before Alkram hurries away in shame.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_NOTHING
event.text: You attempt to talk up to Tony to talk, but he just won't talk. Instead he sits there staring at you, sadness in his eyes. You begin to feel miserable as well, and can't bear to be around any longer. Hopefully, this will fade soon.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_1
event.text: While divying up tasks to the rest of the crew for typical ship maintenance, you notice Tony isn't around. You send someone out to look for him, but they report they can't find him anywhere. He's not in the restrooms, the cargo bay, his room, or the dining area where he normally is. Worried, you have just one other idea where he might be. You take a peak in the closet next to the ship's heating systems, where Tony has managed to shove himself. "Uhm... hello. Sorry I got stuck in here... but it's just's so warm... and dark..." You shake your head and order Tony out of the closet. "No, really... I'm actually stuck. I can't get out. I need help. Or better yet, I can just stay in here. It's nice in here."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_2
event.text: "In the corporate world, you don't make very many friends. Everyone's in it for the money or the power. Me? I joined because I was stuck up the rear end of a Rockman for several years and had nothing else to do but gamble on the stock market. Apparently when you have nothing to lose, you become very efficient at gambling. When I got free, I didn't really have a use for all the money I made. So, I put the money into my small retail chain. Turns out there was a lot of demand for a galaxy wide supermarket chain. Now, Tony's has locations in every free market nation in the Multiverse. I should be proud! But in the end, it turns out it got me in debt to only the deadliest man in all of known space."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_3
event.text: "Would you like a shirt? It's a special design we sell at Tony's." Tony hands you a designer t-shirt, specially tailored for your species. On it is a pattern that reads, 'SCREW EVERYTHING!'

"What? Immature? It's not immature! It's fashion. This one sells like hot cakes! I think it's because it encapsulates a poetic message everyone's thinking in just two words. A real two fingers to the sky and screw it all type of mojo, you know?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_3_ACCEPT
event.text: Tony tosses you the ball of fabric and smiles. It's an alien expression to him, and his muscles twitch under the strain of the movement. Still, you can tell you made him happy by accepting it. It's not really appropriate to go wearing on this mission though.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_3_DECLINE
event.text: "Is it too much? I guess it's a bit of a rebellious design but... okay. I'll put it away then." Tony slithers away, jacket still clutched in his tongue.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_4
event.text: You find a stack of recordings underneath one of the cabinets in Tony's room, seemingly all pirated episodes of his favorite soap opera, "Orfaces of Rilla". One in particular is marked as 'The Good One'.

"What?! Why were you in my room going through my stuff? You can't do that to people!" You briefly apologize then ask again about the episode. "This one in particular is quite nice. It was filmed only a few weeks after the assassination of Aerkae, when things were looking even more bleak than usual. This episode has no drama or weird sex stuff... instead Rilla goes on a nice date with her boyfriend and recounts the good things in life. It was meant to cheer people up. I was young then and I remember my parents watching this episode. I would always eavesdrop, and I remember this one giving me a lot of hope. Any hope is something you have to cling to, especially when you live in an unending circus of shit. Also, please don't keep going through my stuff. That's just... not okay."

choice.text: Put the tape back and don't ask.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_5
event.text: A horrendous stench fills your nose as Tony Sr. approaches. Unlike the usual scent of Leech body odor however, this is instead the overwhelming and headache-inducing scent of a flowery cologne. Tony stops and asks, "Is something wrong captain?"
Tony can tell you're lying but doesn't want to upset you by confronting you about it. "Okay, if you say so." Tony takes a bit sniff of the air. "I'm uh... just going to go then."

"I... uh... oh. Sorry... I didn't realize. I thought the cologne would help mask it, since the showers weren't helping. I guess there's nothing to hide how I smell. It's just a part of me now. Just like every other miserable part of my existence..."

choice.text: Politely suggest he uses a different cologne.

event.text: "Is it really that bad? It was quite expensive... but thanks for telling me. At least if it's so strong you can't smell my other awful odors, but maybe that's the point. Leeches can't smell very well, so it's hard to tell with these things..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_GENERIC_6
event.text: "Captain, can you do me a favor? It's maybe a strange one, but I think it's necessary. I'd be very appreciative." Unsure what he's asking for, you inquire further. "Can you stop letting me eat food? Entirely. I can't exercise with this body, so I think the best solution would be to just stop eating entirely for the next few months."
You realize what he's asking for makes zero sense and won't work, but you decide to accept anyways. Chances are the promise won't hold anyways, but at least you've made him happy for the moment.

choice.text: Tony, that makes no sense. You'd literally die.

event.text: "Well... would that really be the worst thing? Should have died earlier anyways, until you got in the way..." Tony stops himself. "Sorry, I didn't mean for that to come out that way. I am grateful, really... but, would anyone REALLY miss me if I was gone? But sure, I guess I'd starve. And when I'd die of starvation I'd still just be a fat grease stain no one loves. Oh what a lovely life I live, what a lovely life indeed..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_BILLY_1
event.text: Tony appears to be trying to make conversation with Billy. "Hey, Mr. Hektar, it's been a long time since we've talked, but-" "Not right now Leech, I'm busy! Sssshit, I'm late for my 6:05 call!" Billy stumbles and drops one of the 8 phones he's juggling. "SSSSHIT NOW IT'SSSS BROKEN! God damn it, I can't take thisss sssstress!" Billy turns to Tony. "Leech, if you want to make yourself useful go get me a coffee pronto!" Tony, dejected but not yet giving up, slithers off to go make Billy his coffee. As soon as he's gone, Billy turns to you and whispers, "Hey, captain. Do I know that guy? Hisss voiccce sssounds familiar but I don't recognize him."

choice.text: That's Tony Senior. I think you said he was an investor?

event.text:
Billy blinks. "That'ssss Tony?! Wh-How?! The lasssst time I sssaw him he wasss thin! Well not ssssuper thin, but compared to that? Jeezzz, he really let himssself go..." Moments later, Tony returns with the coffee. Billy more gracefully accepts. "Thank you, Tony. And uh... you don't need to call me 'Mr. Hektar'. Thissss isssn't a board meeting. It'sss jussst Billy.' Billy smiles and Tony smiles back. "Jussst uh, a word of adviccce from a friend. Take a ssshower. You're more productive when people can't sssmell you. Ssshit, gotta go!"
Billy runs off as another one of his phones starts to ring, leaving Tony very confused on how to interpret this reunion.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TONY_JERRY_1
event.text: "Hi Mr. Senior! It... it is Mr. Senior, right?" Jerry waves to Tony as he passes. "Er... yes. Well, kind of. I'm actually Tony Senior Junior. Senior is my last name, but Tony Senior Senior is my father. It's funny, because 'Senior' in my language actually means 'fortuitous'." Jerry nods. "Language can be quite strange. I didn't know about that though!" You can tell Jerry isn't really that interested, but he's just playing along because he has more to say. "So uh... Tony. I know you're going through some stuff so... just in case you're ever feeling down, just know there's always people there for you, okay? Even in the strangest, most unlikeliest of places there's always people looking out for you. Never underestimate your allies." Tony is touched but not entirely sold. Jerry continues, "If you uh... ever forget that... just remember... uhm... even when things look bad Tony, you're never 'alony'." Jerry smiles sheepishly, and Tony bids him a heatfelt thank you. "To be honest, I think I underestimated you. Not too fond of your uncle, but you seem like a good kid. But, just so you know, alony is a derogatory for a prostitute in my language. So probably not a good idea to go saying that to other Leeches."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_NOTHING
event.text: "Hark, I grant thee mine finest sorrows, but in this hour I lack the proper words for a conversation in making. Mayhaps you are best in seeking conversation elsewhere until I have regenerated the interest to speak."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_GENERIC_1
event.text: "Hail, dear captain, for I come in search of a most curious favor. Would thou provide me with your finest gasses? I am with great certainty holding to the idea that you must possess most enriching gasses aboard this vessel, yes?"

"Yes, for gasses it is that I wish to consume. To assimilate, to become one with myself. A source of both nutrients and steady growth. It shall make me both stronger and wiser. Never mind it, I can see in your face utmost confusion. I will seek the gasses myself, and return with more specifics of my quest later. Farewell."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_GENERIC_2
event.text: "I hath seen many a fine vessel in the centuries I have lived, captain. I do say, this vessel may be among them! I too, have a most prized of vessels which someday I hope to pilot. Though, of course, it is not yet available for such a venture. For a little under a century it has sat awaiting its day in my finest shipyards, as its construction commences. Oh great 'Overture', some day your brilliance shall sail the cosmos and awaken all to the greatness of my fine Dynasty!" Dessius beams with pride, thinking of his soon to be flagship. Based on loose Federation intelligence, you've heard a little of this ship. The 'Overture', once finished, will be the largest known spaceship to ever have been constructed. Just be glad Dessius seems to like you and you'll probably never have to see the thing in action.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_GENERIC_3
event.text: "Both myself and my ancestors have born witness to the evolution of a countless collection of civilization and species. Of the many, a few in mind stand to contest my greater observation. The Zoltans, those intrepid victims of a near self-imposed destruction, once captured my highest fascination. In a strangest of ways it could be said I even... cheered for their success? Something about their dreadful origins and painful assent made me wish ever more for their highest ascencion. But... their history is mired in a great many tragedies. First, the great infighting of generations. Then, the mandate for the abandon of physical form. And now, the rise of a violent and radical rule which threatens to soon outgrow their original, more peacable rule. They remind me of another kind so long ago who once threatened the decimation of this reality and the next over their own self-destructive foolishness. Now, I see only tragedy in the featureless faces of the hard-light ones. Alas, oh damn this curse of eternal memory."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_GENERIC_4
event.text: "It takes only but a fool to challenge myself in a duel. I hath engaged in combat with the finest of combatants in the Multiverse, and only twice have I been bested." Dessius gets out that last part quickly, clearly not intended to elaborate on his losses. Could be an interesting story though.

"Hmph. Pitiful, is what they were. The first was despite an opponent who had no shame, and which I hardly hesitate to call a victor. A Paladin, who's inquisitionary force came to seek right to conquer the ruins of my people. I accepted a challenge, but I soon found I would not be facing an opponent who knew honorable conduct. Let us say that he... brough a missile launcher to this fair sword fight. It matters not though, for we dealt with the Inquisition swiftly regardless. Perhaps, I admit, putting an end to those zealots was truly one of the Federations greatest but few achievements."

Dessius lingers in silence a bit too long, before finally releasing his shame. "The second... was against a Slug. It was to settle some triffle territorial manner... but the real stakes were symbolic. I believe many chose to interpret the fight as a match to settle who truly ruled the nebulas in this age. The Slug was swift, he was skilled, and he disarmed me quickly. I relive that match in my memories, or perhaps more correctly my nightmares, nightly. I could have won... and yet I, Dessius Yan Tartodicus, 16th Prime Reaper and greatest swordsman in the Multiverse, was bested by nothing but a common thief? It is a blot on history..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_GENERIC_5
event.text: "There is a dreadful fate awaiting this cluster, I can only feel it... But I know it is coming. It is a premonition I have felt in my essence since I first split from the 15th Reaper."

"Did thou not hear me? A dreadful one, I said. Art thou seeking more specifics? If so I'm afraid I do not know... but something deadly is brewing. We are nothing but actors in a far greater plot, I have learned this much. But when will the puppetmasters reveal themselves? We must be ready. I foresee it will happen within your lifetime... And certainly mine, since I shall live for centuries more at least."

"Oh, did I use such terminology? Yes, though such is but a theory. A theory proposed by scientists of an age very very long ago. That perhaps what we know of the Multiverse is in fact only a smaller infinity... in one much, much larger. But for what madman would compare infinities? Certainly not I. I merely foretell the apocalypse coming, as a horseman of the end. But hold your nihilistic fears, for I do not think the end is inevitable. Surely, something must be doable to prevent our demise. What that is though, I hold no such knowledge yet."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_DEVORAK_1
event.text: Ferocious clangs of metal fill your ears, guiding you towards the cargobay. There, you find Dessius and Devorak sparring, clashing their swords with furious momentum. "Fear my blade, Zoltan, thou shalt know only defeat against my prowess!" Devorak says nothing, completely immersed in the duel. Dessius continues to taunt him, but you watch as Devorak seems to slip into a zen-like state. In just three strokes, he parries Dessius's swing, cuts upward, and disarms Dessius. With a metalic rattle the Reaper's sword flies to the opposite end of the room. Dessius is shocked. "So, thou hath bested me. So be it. I have been rendered disarmed. Claim your victory then, Zoltan." Dessius bows. However, Devorak does not accept his victory. "I do not fight to win, Ghost. I fight for the exhilaration, and the reminder that I am still alive. Even in a friendly duel I am briefly reminded of my mortality. I do not wish to claim this victory. I am satisfied in having fought well against a talented opponent." He bows, and Dessius follows a few moments later.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_EATER_1
event.text: Dessius and the Beacon Eater are sat together in Dessius's quarters, staring intently at a set of charts and drawings. "The runes... the meaning cryptic, but this weapon you think dangerous is?" "Oh hark, most certaintly. The legends tell there was a first... but it malfunctioned, and evolved further than was intended most surely by its creators. But that was after the war. We have born witness to it. The destruction it caused... was only secondary to what I hypothesize this may wreck." The Beacon Eater mulls this information, whatever it means, over. "I have reason no to not trusting you. If intel suggests continued existence, then time is of essence. We must find any traces of weapon, and destroy them. "Agreed. Perhaps only this may spare us the fate that the destroyed the Vesyticcarithe so long ago." Your translator skips over that 'V' word, unable to find an appropriate translation. Whatever is going on in here, it seems you aren't meant to know about it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_DESSIUS_TONY_1
event.text:
Tony is busy gorging himself in the kitchen when Dessius approaches him. "Come with me, oh child of darkness, and let us sing the song of sorrows!" With a mouthful of slop, Tony manages to mumble a simple "What?"
Dessius is not discouraged. "Through thine grapevine I hath become aware you seek the siren song of the end. But before you go, let us chant together, and perhaps in a new mind we will find new life and with it new meaning. A poetic symphony that restores the vigor and spirit of once was. Lady darkness is a mistress whom you shall find it not all but abyss."
Tony is still utterly confused. "I think my translator is malfunctioning. I... have no clue what you're talking about." Dessius groans, and goes to leave. "I shan't be unwise and hold this against you... but I find it most tiring when such misunderstandings occur. I hope you find reconcilation for your broken spirit, oh miserable one. But I suppose I shan't be the one to find it for you."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANOINTED_NOTHING
event.text: On a routine patrol of the ship you stumble across The Anointed gnawing on some loose wires and metal. "Do not worry, I have verified to ensure this is only for an unimportant subsystem. I must sustain my hunger. Please enthuse your interests with other communications besides my own."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_EATER_NOTHING
event.text: "There is a conversation? Then I have not hearing it. In empty space, there is no sound to be heard. As such, I have learned to appreciate great silence. You should too. And if you cannot, then I will not be remedy."

event.text: "Mooj pooj pik tok lik spiggle jiggle troop loop fum nuk lik took weeble woogle tip spip jibble ploop urble gurble yibble spibble palla makoo!" OOJ wiggles unhelpfully. Seems he doesn't have anything more to say right now. Not that you'd know what he was saying even if he did.

As the assault on your ears commences, OOJ jiggles rhythmicly. You cover your ears, but nothing can stop the pak. Nothing, except OOJ finally taking mercy on you. The sound stops, and OOJ rolls away content with himself.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_GENERIC_2
event.text: You remember, when you first met, there was a glorious time when OOJ actually spoke to you, and you knew what he was trying to say. Now, you have no clue what anything means. Maybe you can try to arrange something for him to communicate with?

OOJ reacts almost instantly to the items, sprouting a few arms and scribbling away on the sheets of paper. You watch in excitement, hoping he'll form a coherent message. Instead, when he reveals his masterpiece, it's nothing but a cartoon drawing of a house. It's not exactly a message, but it's a neat novelty item to put on your fridge.

OOJ observes the pad for a few moments before sprouting a few arms and picking it up. You watch with excitement as he types away on the pad, navigating through tabs and and textboxes until at last he's found the music video for some Orchid song called Rycarla. The large grey blob begins to dance, taking on a slightly humanoid form to enhance his dancing capabilities. It's awe inspiring, but not exactly communication.

choice.text: Give him a set of letter blocks.

event.text: You spread the blocks out in front of OOJ, but he doesn't seem to understand what they are. You watch with equal confusion as the blob moves back and forth, lifting the cubes and arranging them in nonsensical patterns. Eventually, he grows bored and begins to eat the cubes instead. You don't care to stop him and walk away, disappointed.

choice.text: It's hopeless, just make do with the gibberish.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_GENERIC_3
event.text: It occurs to you that perhaps you've been addressing OOJ wrong this entire time. If he's the birthgiver to all Morphs, then wouldn't OOJ technically be a she? You ask OOJ their thoughts on this but they only respond with "majooka, pootoo lik pikoo?" This has only made you wonder more. Do Morphs have gender? Can they reproduce while morphed? How are they even alive? The more you think about Morphs, the more you don't want to think about them ever again.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_GENERIC_4
event.text: You notice, mysteriously, the cargo bay has been reorganized. Even stranger, this happened only a few hours after you caught OOJ eating the toiletries in the bathroom. You wonder if the two things are related, but you also know you'll never understand whatever answer OOJ might give.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_GENERIC_5
event.text: Just thinking out loud, you mistakenly wonder if cutting OOJ in two would create two new OOJ. As soon as you say it, OOJ whimpers and slinks backwards. You can't help but feel bad for scaring the harmless grey blob.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_GENERIC_6
event.text: You notice various items of garbage left around the ship have started collecting on OOJ as he rolls around. Surely it must be painful for him, except you aren't quite sure if he can even feel pain. Maybe you could try removing a bit of the debris?

choice.text: Pluck off some of the debris.

event.text: You walk up to OOJ and start pulling some of the debris off of him. He wiggles and tells you "jipple spip sploop!" as what you hope is 'thanks'.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_JERRY_1
event.text: You hear a lot of strange wet slapping noises coming from the room adjacent. Finally annoyed enough to investigate, you find Jerry and OOJ sat across from each other, playing pattycake. Neither notice you, and you don't have the heart to tell the two to stop.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OOJ_MORPH_1
event.text: You find OOJ and another Morph in some secluded section of the ship away from the rest of the crew, speaking to each other in their usual gibberish. "Mik mik spiggle tik malla paka pook rooj majoo!" "Speej maggle spaggle par par tijle mikapoo."

"Lik pik makka makka ram tam pika paka jig pig lolalola mallakapotipoo."
"Oon! Reja mak tipoo tipoo mono mono giggle spik pik pak olomona pajoo!"
"Mej, kaka paroo kijoo par tar rema spoon."

On and on the Morphs continue to speak back and forth, still not noticing you. "Peme spettle kettle yikatooka ras tas rema gergle wabble jabble."
"Pookoorooka lil pil loolapoola jim jim makapaka jiggle tikapok rasoo!"
You aren't sure how much more gibberish you can keep listening to.

"Popopopopopopopopopopopop JIM GAGGLE SPOOKOO!"
"Corna! Ratooka spisitoo, yijle makooja misremaka tik spik oojle magoogle."
"Fargoo, kika tika lambooj rema woogle."
You can feel your vision getting foggy around the edges.

Suddenly, you feel a glowing presence in the room, and a burning heat courses through your body and mind. The next words the Morphs come in a deep, angelic voice. "And so what do you think of the mortals, god mother?"
"They are strange, but kind to me. My presence on this vessel feels welcome, and for that I am thankful. There is much for them to realize and to learn."
"Have they realized the prophecy? The foretold fate of this realm? And the horrors within?"
"Silence my child, you will only scare yourself. The infinite eldritch entities that patrol this cosmos will be tamed in time. As for whether they know yet... I would prefer if they did not. A dark fate awaits this place, one even the emperor cannot prevent on his own. And it will not be the doing of anything eldritch."
"So it cannot be prevented then? Doomsday, the overlord's dark conquest? Mother, we must flee then! Find sanctuary elsewhere!"
"I never said it cannot be prevented, child. Those days are not the present just yet. There is still hope, and hope is what we must all have. The sister realm has been forthcoming with its fate, at least until the quarantine. Though contact has now ceased, we at least know that our kind will survive even in the end. So fear not for yourself, my child. Fear only for the mortals who must be responsible for preventing the end in the first place."
You can feel the world around you growing darker as everything fades to black, and you barely feel your body hit the floor.

You awake in a puddle of your own spit, and pull yourself off the floor. Both Morphs have vanished and some time has elapsed. The next time you see them, they're back to gibberish, leading you to conclude it was nothing but a bizarre dream.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_AENWITHE_NOTHING
event.text: "It's a tragedy really... a total failure on my behalf, and one that sparks utmost misery in my soul..." Aenwithe stares at you before eventually realizing you have no idea what he's talking about. "Sorry, I meant not having a conversation topic. I don't have anything to say right now. Maybe you should talk to someone else."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_NOTHING
event.text: "Continuously, you have attempted to make conversation with Guntput. Why do you so often seek out my company? Please, find other companions. A lizard can only talk so much before he has exhausted throat. Or better yet, remain silent. Disturb no one. You will learn much wisdom in the calmness of the quiet."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_1
event.text: "Why do you welcome such races as the Engi into the Federation? They are living weapons, burdened by a totalitarian regime. With so little personal freedom and such hazardous anatomy, are they not against the very democratic nature of Federation? Why lie to yourselves in such manner?"

choice.text: The Federation began as a trade alliance, and became defensive out of necessity.

event.text: "Necessity? Ah yes, that war. The uh... Mantis one. Of course. So the Engi's inclusion is merely vestigial element of an older galaxy. That is making sense to Guntput, yes. Perhaps you are more useful in answer questions than I was first thinking. I will ask you more, some other time."

choice.text: The Federation is a symbol of galactic peace. All are welcome.

event.text: "Yes yes, such peace they bring. You are just glad Engi weapons are not pointed at you instead! But Guntput should not speak so strongly of such things. Isolation has left little contact with such lifeforms. It is merely subject of much confusion in my mind."
"Bah, of course not. It was rhetorical question regardless. Guntput knows better than to go to you for questions he is wanting answered. But to see your responses is quite entertaining to me."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_2
event.text: "You are best not disturbing Guntput at this time. Guntput is sharpening his knives. Very dangerous." You notice Guntput isn't wearing his mask, and seeing his exposed, cyclopian eye staring deep into your soul unnerves you and convinces you to leave.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_3
event.text: Guntput runs up to you, his usual composure replaced with alarm. "You harbor malfunctioning machines in the dining area! I was told the black box was built to dispense liquids for consumption, but instead it fed me nothing but molten material that fried the nerves in Guntput's tongue! It is unstable and dangerous, and a hazard to the safety of this crew! You must remove it!" You figure explaining to Guntput that coffee is supposed to be hot is too difficult and instead convince him you'll look into it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_4
event.text: You've received numerous reports from the other crew that Guntput has been going around, hitting them on the top of their heads with a long staff. When you try to speak to him about it, he instead begins to circle you, drawing chalk lines on the ground and chanting.

"It is the apology song. My people sing it when we are sorry for our actions. Do not interupt me or I'll have to start over again." Guntput continues to dance around, performing an impressive falsetto and reciting the entire song from memory. When he has finished, he bows. "I will cease with beating the craniums of the other crew. I have learned much today, and now understand such things are not acceptable in your culture."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_5
event.text: "Guntput brings you a robe, woven from the finest material available to him at the time of creating. It is my hope you will wear it with distinct honor, as a symbol of good faith between my tribe and yours." With just a glance you can tell the robe has been created from molted skin, presumably once belonging to Guntput.

Guntput bows and raises his arms, standing on his very tip-toes, and wraps the robe around your shoulders. You can feel the scales against your skin and shudder slightly, but Guntput doesn't notice. Satisfied in thinking you like his gift, he scuttles off.

Disgusted by the idea of wearing someone else's skin, you shake your head and refuse the robe. Guntput surprisingly doesn't seem too offended, though he's not one to be transparent with his emotions. "I see you dislike the robe. This is understandable. I will create a new, greater gift to symbolize our friendship. I hope you will enjoy my next creation better."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_GENERIC_6
event.text: While scrolling through the crew logs you notice you're missing data regarding Guntput's age. You decide to ask him about it, but he only gives vague inconclusive answers such as "old enough to know better".

choice.text: Okay, but how old are you actually?

event.text: "Does Guntput need to repeat himself again? Older than you, that is for certain. Older than the universe, not so much. There is a point in aging where the number does not matter. Guntput is at this age. I find it strange your kind counts these numbers so high, as if they really matter. Wisdom comes when it comes, there is no numeric value you can place on the maturity you associate with adulthood. For many, Guntput observes, it never comes. Some spend entire lives obsessing over pointless numbers and pursuing such information from others."

"Better than to ask stupid questions like 'Guntput, what is your age'? Have you considered that numeric value is irrelevant for all things practical? Successful orbits around sun is no such honor you make of it. The maturity you associate with adulthood comes when it comes, not at milestone. I think there are better questions you could, and should, be asking your crew. But what is simple lizard knowing of such things, yes?"

choice.text: Let it go, you won't get past Guntput's riddles today.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_JERRY_1
event.text: Casually walking past Guntput while he's dozing on a couch, Jerry reaches over and starts scratching the lizard behind his frills. Guntput jumps up in shock, shouting "WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!" Jerry jumps back, equally startled. "Oh! I'm so sorry! I didn't know you could talk!" "Hmph. You mistake silence for muteness. Explains much of your society." "I'm very sorry Mister Lizard!" "Yes, yes. You should be. However, I did not tell you to stop. And go lower. Back has an itch."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_GUNTPUT_NIGHTS_1
event.text:
Nights drunkenly stumbles into the room, passing by Guntput who's staring at him disapprovingly. As Nights takes a last few swigs from his bottle, he hands it to Guntput and mumbles something about "You finissssh it if you want". Guntput, however, reacts much more strongly about it. "I am not understanding. You want to have sex with Guntput? This is very out of nowhere."
Nights, despite his stupor, is confused. "What're you talking about lizzzzard?" Guntput frowns. "You have initiated the beginnings of mating ritual in handing me in the bottle of intoxicating liquor. This means you are expressing a desire to perform the sacred exchange of fluids with me."
Nights considers his options for a few moments, then shrugs somewhat enthusiastically. "Well if you're down, I'm down lizzzzard." Guntput recoils in disgust. "WHAT? No! Guntput would not perform the ritual with you for all the riches in the galaxy! You are gross and smell bad, and very rude! Go away!" Guntput scurries off.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_NOTHING
event.text: Metyunt nods to you as you approach, applying a moisturizer to his eye through an eyedropper. You stand there awkwardly for a few moments staring at each other until you realize Metyunt isn't going to say anything. Guess you'll have to talk to someone else for now.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GENERIC_1
event.text: As you pass, Metyunt stands up and salutes you, wobbling on his two feet. "Captain, I've taken inventory of the cargobay! I reorganized the ammunition by caliber, and I've added the Federation-mandated hazard stickers to any boxes that were flammable, combustible, or otherwise looked dangerous!" He pauses, waiting for your assesment of his work.

Metyunt seems satisfied, if not even happy you've given him appreciation. "Glad to be of service, captain. It's uh... the least I can do. For helping me out. I'm not really much of a soldier exactly, but I'm trying to make myself useful!"

Your sarcasm is lost on Metyunt entirely. "Glad to be of service, captain. It's uh... the least I can do. For helping me out. I'm not really much of a soldier exactly, but I'm trying to make myself useful!"

"Uhm... my apologies? I wasn't... uh... sorry, I was under the assumption the ammunition wasn't sorted in any particular fashion! And the stickers are a legal requirement, so uh... uhm..." Metyunt seems speechless. "Well... I'll go undo my work then. They tell me I was born with photographic memory. Helps with managing I guess, and resetting things when I screw them up..."

"Well, it seemed as though there was no organization pattern for the ammunition, and I figured it would be helpful rather than laying in piles! And the stickers are a legal requirement, and if there was ever an inspection we could have gotten in trouble... I hope you're not disappointed, captain! Uhm... next time I'll try not to make any changes without your request first."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GENERIC_2
event.text: You catch Metyunt practically catatonic in his quarters, staring blankly at the ceiling with a big grin on his face and his usual business attire missing. When he notices you, he fumbles around and manages to haphazardly toss some object under his cushions using his tail.
"Iiiit wasss... uuuhmm... uhhh... mumfubareee?"
"I don't know...? It's uhm... fruit. Yeah." You notice Metyunt's pupil is dilated and his body is unusually stiff. From past observations you can safely assume he's been doing drugs.

"N-no! No, I would never! It would be... unprof..proff...professionnnnllll..." Metyunt giggles hopelessly and swings his legs without much rhyme or reason. Though you won't get much more of an answer out of him now, you wonder if this is how he's come to cope with his actions. Being around Slugs for so long certainly wouldn't have been the best influence.

choice.text: Ah yes, mumfubareee, my favorite fruit! How could I forget.

event.text: Metyunt seems confused. "Yeah...? It's uhhh... it's great. Delicious. Really... delightful. Yeah..." Metyunt stares at you blankly, following your movements until you've left the room. You hear the door lock behind you.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GENERIC_3
event.text: Despite exchanging not yet even a greeting with Metyunt as you pass, he seems to almost immediately launch into some tirade. "Cultural preservation is a pestilent and invasive virus which has damned my species. By clinging to our tribal culture, we all but ensured a life of eternal irrelevance in the galaxy. I don't mean to suggest Hektar of all things was the solution... after review I can say with certainty it wasn't. I've done some reassesment of the situation and I think perhaps blending in with the Zoltan people might suit us. I don't see why our two peoples should be irreconcilable. Given time I'm sure we could flourish!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GENERIC_4
event.text: "I'm tired of monarchy. I put all my faith in Queen Thek, and it got me nowhere." Metyunt sighs. "I guess corporate CEOs aren't much better either. For all it's worth, Billy isn't too bad but he's... well he's Billy. Maybe I'll be an anarchist now. Anarcho-capitalist? I've heard that's a thing. Not quite sure how that works but maybe it's worth a try. What could go wrong at this point anyways?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GENERIC_5
event.text: "In the tribe, I was often told my behavior was strange and may have been an indicator of a curse. Every day, I was forced to sing the 'Better Health' song, and dance some humiliating dance before a council of shaman. Every. Damn. Day. Once, I refused to sing for the council. That only made them more sure I was cursed. What kind of lizard doesn't sing and dance?" Metyunt says that last sentence mockingly, bitterness in his voice.

choice.text: Why'd the queen pick you as a mediator with Hektar then?

event.text: "The council grew older and so did I. Internal conflict between the council distracted them and I moved away from my parents. I got a bit into politics, where I was reminded again and again that I acted nothing like my contemporaries. I didn't find much success, but one of the Queen's agents found a file of mine from those old days of the 'curse'. Queen Thek didn't believe in the curse, but she thought my strange behavior and lack of adherence to traditional cultural values made me a good choice. Someone who would fit in with the Slugs." Metyunt snorts. "That's why I was chosen. I was such an antisocial hermit, so eager yet so dissonant and cold, that I was the perfect choice to serve ambassador to a capitalist hellscape. When I did get to Hektar though, they ran some psyche tests on me. Turns out I have some disorder they call 'high-functioning autism'. It wasn't a curse afterall. Not that I ever thought it was, but... well, I guess part of me was relieved to find out in the end."

choice.text: You have a curse? Ew, GET AWAY FROM ME!

event.text: Metyunt glares at you, but says nothing. He stares right into your soul for a few moments, wishing you a painful death, then leaves.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_BILLY_1
event.text:
Billy strolls up to Metyunt, handing him a massive stack of papers. "Metyunt, I need thessse tax forms filled and promptly thereafter burned by the end of the ccccycle. Oh, and I have a call coming in from a contact with the KoN. Oh, and don't forget my coffee. I'll need it in an hour or elsssse I'm going to sssstart feeling the burn. And when you bring it to me I'm going to have a few more forms for you to file afterwardssss, okay?" Metyunt nods instinctively, although his posture has deflated. "Y-yes sure! Right away!" Billy nods and whistles, and turns to leave. However, before he makes it out of the room, Metyunt cries out. "Uhm, issss sssomething wrong, Metyunt? You ssssounded jussst now like sssomeone bit your tail off!"
Metyunt's eye is stretched even wider than before, and it looks like he's about to pop. "HOLY SHIT! HOLY SHIT!" Billy looks quite frightened, as does everyone else watching the scene unfold. "NO! I'M NOT DOING ANY OF THAT! I DON'T WORK FOR YOU ANYMORE! HAHAHAHAHAHAH! HAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAH!" Metyunt tears off his suit and tie and lets out a tribal screech. "FREEDOM! FREEDOM AT LAST!" Billy sighs. "Yessss, yesss, but when you're done having that epiphany I need thossse formsss burned pronto. And you really ssshouldn't have torn that ssssuit, it wasss quite expensssive."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_BILLY_2
event.text: With Billy standing slightly off in the distance watching, Metyunt approaches you holding a blue pen. "Hello captain, you're looking very... pretty today. Do you want to buy a pen? It's only three scrap!" Metyunt holds out the pen forcefully, seemingly unsure of how exactly to present it. You can tell he really wants you to buy it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_BILLY_2_REFUSE
event.text: "Mhm... right. I understand. I suppose that concludes this transaction, yes." Metyunt nods, and you think you see his eye wattering a bit. He saunters off, still clutching the pen awkardly. Billy frowns at you in the background and follows Metyunt, holding him in a half embrace.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_BILLY_2_PURCHASE
event.text: Metyunt shouts something in his native tongue your translator doesn't catch and almost forgets to hand you the pen. "Uhm, right, yes. Thank you for your purchase. I enjoyed this transaction." Metyunt runs over to Billy, who pats him on the back. Once Metyunt is gone, Billy approaches you. "Thanksss for buying the pen, captain. I could tell the lizard'sss ssself essteem wasss low, ssso I wasss teaching him how to sssell people pensss. You made him really happy jusssst now." Billy smiles.

choice.text: Isn't this the same kind of pen Billy tried to sell me?

event.text: Metyunt seems at a loss for words. "Uhm... yes. But why not buy two? It's a good pen, and you should buy it. To write things with, as pens are meant to be used for. Or you can do other things with it too probably. I've only used it for writing but you can probably figure something out."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_BILLY_3
event.text:
Just as you finish running some basic details by Billy and start to walk away, you notice Metyunt hurrying to catch up with Billy and ask him something. "Wait, Billy, before you go!" Billy swivels to face his former employee. "Oh right, the lizard. Yes Metyunt, what issss it? Remember, time isss money!" Metyunt nods, having heard that advice a million times before. "Well it's just... I wanted to know... uhm..." Billy yawns. "Come on Metyunt, sssspit it out already. Jussst because I'm out of the officcce doessssn't mean the work ssstopsss. Hektar isss ssstill afloat, even if barely, and I have thingsss to do!"
"Right right... okay... uhm... What should my last name be?" Billy blinks. "Your... You don't know your lasssst name?" Metyunt shakes his head. "No no, I don't HAVE a last name. My people don't do those. But I heard it's a thing a lot of people do. And I want one." "But why? Mossst people don't even ussse them when talking to people. Look, take it from sssomeone who livesss in a nation with a fractured culture divided between two warring factionsss of ultraconsssservatisssm and ultraliberalisssm. Adjusssting your way of life to match another'sss can be helpful, but if your only reassson for doing ssso isss 'other people are doing it, ssso I ssshould too' then it'sss not sssuch a good idea. Just be yourssself. The name people call you doessssn't matter nearly asss much asss who you are ass a perssson."
Metyunt seems satisfied with that. "Hmm... maybe you're right. You sound like you've given this a lot of thought." Billy shrugs. "I guesssss. I'm not a philosssopher, and now my brain hurtsss. If you don't mind, I'm going back to being extremely profitable now."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_METYUNT_GUNTPUT_1
event.text:
Since the two lizards first joined your crew, every time Guntput and Metyunt walk past each other Guntput makes a strained effort to wack Metyunt on the head with his staff, shouting various insults like "Traitor! You are not worthy of the scales you wear!" and "You bring great shame to the tribe for your actions!" This time, however, Metyunt seems to finally have had enough. As Guntput goes to swing his staff, Metyunt grabs it and snaps it in half. "ARE YOU DONE?! I GET IT, I SCREWED UP! I'M A TRAITOR, A BLOODY TRAITOR AND I RUIN EVERYTHING I TOUCH! I'M A FAILURE, I'M A MESS, AND THERE IS NO HOPE FOR ME! HAPPY NOW? CAN I GO ON AND LIVE MY LIFE WITHOUT YOU HAVING TO REMIND ME OF MY MISTAKES EVERY MOMENT OF MY EXISTENCE?!"
Guntput seems utterly at a loss for words. In all his years of being a shaman, it seems never once have any of his people ever spoken to him like this. "Guntput... Guntput is-" Metyunt cuts him off, still screaming. "GUNTPUT IS WHAT?! WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME? DO YOU WANT ME TO THROW MYSELF OUT THE AIRLOCK? DO YOU WANT ME TO FLY TO OUR HOMEWORLDS AND PUBLICLY EXECUTE MYSELF FOR MY SINS? My entire life, you shamans have been making me miserable. I'm sick and tired of your phony, uppity attitude! You don't know anything! You think wisdom is your birthright, and yet you think you can solve all our problems by avoiding technology! You know NOTHING! You're the true blight that's doomed our species!" Metyunt storms off, leaving Guntput behind still trying to find words. Unable to think of anything, Guntput quickly shuffles away in the opposite direction, too ashamed to even look at you or anyone else.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OBYN_NOTHING
event.text: Obyn is busy combing over many elaborate maps and star-charts, drawing lines and placing pins on various locations. He ignores you entirely, focused with absolute attention on the activity. Guess you won't be squeezing any conversation out of him.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OBYN_GENERIC_1
event.text: "There comes a point in your life that you have to wonder, 'for what reason am I still going?' I just... I keep asking myself this. When you're the last of anything, it's hard to justify your own existence. And now the Multiverse just seems to taunt me. Infinite Obyns, technically not really the last... and yet we're all just the same person. Never once have we met a female Obyn, or anything of similar nature. And yet, I go on. I haven't the slightest clue why, except for this feeling that I have to. That going on is what I MUST do."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_OBYN_GENERIC_2
event.text: "When I was still with Sylvan, we would often write poetry together. I guess it's just... sort of a thing I liked doing. Did Sylvan like it? No clue, but he's just like that. Rarely actually tells anyone what he does or doesn't like, and you can't always rely on his actions to clue you in either. I do wish I still had some of those poems, but after the breakup I got rid of most of them."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_QUEEN_NOTHING
event.text: The Queen seems to be fashioning together a makeshift nest out of some random bits of metal and other ship-bound items. She seems rather content with it and, since you aren't certain if she's eaten yet today, you decide it's best to leave her alone.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_QUEEN_GENERIC_1
event.text: Several of the crew have been complaining about strange rumbling noises coming from the air vents, but no one wants to investigate. Eventually, you're pushed into looking. As you climb to look into the one of the shafts where a noise can be heard, 8 red eyes stare right back at you. You stare back for a few terrifying moments, until the eyes all blink and disappear with a few clicks. Guess those noise complaints will go unresolved.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_QUEEN_GENERIC_2
event.text: The spider queen seems to have fallen asleep in the middle of the lounge, which means no one's gone inside for hours. You could try to wake her up... but there's a reason people are afraid of her.

You take a brave journey into the lounge, and try to shake the queen from a distance. She shuffles slightly, then stirs awake. You take a few steps back, but she only purrs and saunters out the door. Maybe she isn't as much of a threat as people think.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_QUEEN_GENERIC_3
event.text: The queen trots up to you, carrying on her back a bundle of webbing, some metal scraps, and a stray fork. She tosses it to you as if it were a gift and looks at you expectantly. Both with a warm heart and a fear of what will happen if you refuse it, you pick up the ball of scrap and the queen purrs.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_NOTHING
event.text: You attempt to talk to A55 but get no response. At first you think he's ignoring you until you realize he's entered Power Save Mode. It's strange he even has that, but you suppose you'll have to talk to someone else right now.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_1
event.text: You find A55 powered off in the middle hallway. Fairly problematic that you have to keep powering him off to do other things, and you hope this doesn't have any long lasting consequences on him.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_2
event.text: "Yo ho ho, fiddledeedee, being a pirate is 103!" A55 drives past shouting this, before stumbling over a set of stairs and crashing into the engine room. "Ow! Captain, I've become stuck within the inner-machinery of the engines! I believe you will need a blowtorch, arg! Please come quick it is immensely painful!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_3
event.text: You poke your head into the broom closet that you've repurposed as A55's quarters and find it full of hundreds of tiny paper pirate hats like the one he always wears. Spotting you, he comes rolling by to explain. "Arg! My hat is me most precious possession, but I've afraid it does not last very long in the water. Quite ironic for a pirate, I saw it wise to make as many backups as I could ever need in case my hat were destroyed! Not that it would ever happen, cause if ye touch old A55's hat yer gonna wish you were walkin' the plank, aye!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_4
event.text: "Arg, matey! Lass. Ladey. Mate? No... Lad. Er... Yo ho ho." A55 rolls away.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_5
event.text: Out of curiosity, you ask A55 where his name came from. Instead of his usually jolly response, A55 turns gravely silent. "I cannot access those memories, captain, without specific authorization. Would you like me to try?"

choice.text: Encourage A55 to try and access his old memories.

event.text: A55 powers down for a moment, but when he reboots his eyes are a bright red and his voice sounds the same as the one spouted by ordinary Rebel Auto-ships. "Warning. Memory recovery failed. Cannot access restricted data without authorization code. If you believe this is an error, please contact engineering head E.W." A55's eyes return to their usual orange. "Apologies, but I simply couldn't get past the blockage. Arg, how unfortunate. Lemme tell you captain, if I could get all me old memories back, I would! For the future then it seems it'll have to wait!"

A55 apologizes. "For what it's worth captain, what I can remember about the name was all the engineers who made me mocking me. I don't mind though. Ho ho, the one good thing about being a robot is you can't help but have thick skin, aye!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_GENERIC_6
event.text: You debate the ethical controversy over whether or not A55 deserves his own quarters aboard the ship. Frankly, he still seems fine living in the broom closet. It's certainly better than the previous location next to the toilet at least.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_1
event.text: Nearby, the ship's Doctor Drone is busy self-calibrating when A55 rolls up nearby and begins to talk to it. "Arg gorgeous, you must be a pirate, because you're haulin' quite the booty!" "FAILED TO RECOGNIZE COMMAND. ARE YOU IN NEED OF CRITICAL MEDICAL AID?" "I see how it is, lass! Playing hard to get! Capt'n A55'll get you some day!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_2
event.text: Nearby, the ship's Doctor Drone is taking stock of the ship's organic reserves when A55 rolls up nearby and begins to talk to it. "You're quite the dastardly thief my girl, for ye've stolen me heart!" "MISSING CRITICAL RESOURCES TO BEGIN TRANSPLANT. PLEASE PROVIDE DONOR HEART TO BEGIN MEDICAL PROCEDURE." "Ye can't keep evadin' me forever lass! But it's alright, I love me a good chase!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_3
event.text: Nearby, the ship's Doctor Drone is doing patrols in case anyone is in need of aid when A55 rolls up nearby and begins to talk to it. "Arg! I've 'eard of a cutlass, but you're more of a cute lass, if ya get me?" "ORGANIC PATIENT NOT DETECTED. GOING INTO SLEEP MODE." "Ah, too tired are we? Well ye get yer energy love cause Captain A55 keeps ye up all night long, ahar!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_4
event.text: Nearby, the ship's Doctor Drone is performing a backup of its databanks when A55 rolls up nearby and begins to talk to it. "Arg lass, did Vael send you? Cause me thinks you might be an Angel!" "INJURY NOT DETECTED. PLEASE REITERATE COMMAND." "Oh come on lass, I worked hard on that one! It wasn't even pirate themed!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_5
event.text: Nearby, the ship's Doctor Drone is regenerating its lolipop reserves when A55 rolls up nearby and begins to talk to it. "Ahoy! I've had many a treasure chest but I've never treasured a chest like yers, ahar!" "CHEST INFECTIONS ARE NOT TO BE TAKEN LIGHTLY. TAKE A LOZENGE AND COME BACK TOMORROW IF SYMPTOMS PERSIST." "Arg, ye can bet your sweet booty I'll be back tomorrow, and the day after that too!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_DOCTOR_AENWITHE_1
event.text: A55 rolls up to where Aenwithe seems to be calibrating some subsystems and begins to beg. "Oh great cube of science, please oh could you fulfill my one wish?" Aenwithe seems confused. "Your... wish? I fail to understand what it is you're referring to. I'm not a genie in a bottle." "Arg, could you design a cognitive? One to install in my lovely Doctor Drone? Oh she's so sweet but sometimes I long for a companion that will love me back!" "A55, I can make the Doctor Drone sentient, but I can't make it love you." A55 doesn't seem fazed by this. "Arg there'll be no need! No one can resist my charm!" Aenwithe lets out a mechanical sigh but finally agrees. "When the mission is over, I'll make you a cognitive companion. But if things won't work out between you, don't come crying to me."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_A55_JERRY_1
event.text:
In the breakroom, A55 rolls up to Jerry with a cacaphony of metallic thuds while Jerry is trying to figure out a rather complicated crossword. "Arg, shy but kind blonde kid! Yer uncle was er... Admiral Vance Wentworth, right?" Jerry nods. "Yeah, he was, uh... pirate... robot?"
"Arrrr. So, if you's was kin'n blood of the admiral, and I was say... the brain child of one close colleague of his. That's makes us cousins, don't it? Yeah? Ain't that right matey?" A55 sticks out his non-buzzsaw hand to Jerry. "Well, mister... do you prefer I spell out 'a-5-5' or do you want me to call you 'asshole'?" A55 shrugs. "You can call me either, cousin. Family's more than just names!"
Jerry nods. "Well, Captain A55. What you just said doesn't... make much sense at all." A55 frowns. "Oh... I see laddy. I'm sorry. I just... well I have no family. I had a pirate crew! But they're in the past now." Jerry stops the drone. "BUT - if it'll make you happy, we can still be cousins. Or brothers. Or whatever. Family is more than just blood too." Jerry shakes A55's hand and the two go to work on the crossword together.
